25 /** @file bits/specfun.h

27  * Do not attempt to use it directly. @headername{cmath}

36

38

42 # error include <cmath> and define __STDCPP_WANT_MATH_SPEC_FUNCS__
43 #endif

80 # include <bits/sf_hermite.tcc>
81 # include <bits/sf_theta.tcc>
82 # include <bits/sf_trigint.tcc>

104 #endif
105 
106 namespace std _GLIBCXX_VISIBILITY(default)
107 {
108 _GLIBCXX_BEGIN_NAMESPACE_VERSION
109 
110  /**
111  * @defgroup math_spec_func C++ Mathematical Special Functions
112  * @ingroup numerics
113  *
114  * A collection of advanced mathematical special functions.
115  * @{
116  */
117 
118  /**
119  * @mainpage Mathematical Special Functions
120  *
121  * @section intro Introduction and History
122  * The first significant library upgrade on the road to C++2011,
123  * <a href="http://www.open-std.org/JTC1/SC22/WG21/docs/papers/2005/n1836.pdf">
124  * TR1</a>, included a set of 23 mathematical functions that significantly
125  * extended the standard transcendental functions inherited from C and declared
126  * in @<cmath@>.
127  *
128  * Although most components from TR1 were eventually adopted for C++11 these
129  * math functions were left behind out of concern for implementability.
130  * The math functions were published as a separate international standard
131  * <a href="http://www.open-std.org/JTC1/SC22/WG21/docs/papers/2010/n3060.pdf">
132  * IS 29124 - Extensions to the C++ Library to Support Mathematical Special
133  * Functions</a>.
134  *
135  * Follow-up proosals for new special functions have also been published:
136  * <a href="http://open-std.org/JTC1/SC22/WG21/docs/papers/2013/n3494.pdf">
137  * A proposal to add special mathematical functions according to
138  * the ISO/IEC 80000-2:2009 standard, Vincent Reverdy</a>.
139  *
140  * <a href="http://open-std.org/JTC1/SC22/WG21/docs/papers/2004/n1668.pdf">
141  * A Proposal to add Mathematical Functions for Statistics
142  * to the C++ Standard Library, Paul A Bristow</a>.
143  *
144  * <a href="http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2015/p0081r0.pdf">
145  * A proposal to add sincos to the standard library, Paul Dreik</a>.
146 
147  * For C++17 these functions were incorporated into the main standard.
148  *
149  * @section contents Contents
150  * The following functions are implemented in namespace @c std:
151  * - @ref std::assoc_laguerre "assoc_laguerre - Associated Laguerre functions"
152  * - @ref std::assoc_legendre "assoc_legendre - Associated Legendre functions"
153  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::assoc_legendre_q
154  * "assoc_legendre_q - Associated Legendre functions of the second kind"
155  * - @ref std::beta "beta - Beta functions"
156  * - @ref std::comp_ellint_1
157  * "comp_ellint_1 - Complete elliptic functions of the first kind"
158  * - @ref std::comp_ellint_2
159  * "comp_ellint_2 - Complete elliptic functions of the second kind"
160  * - @ref std::comp_ellint_3 "comp_ellint_3 - Complete elliptic functions of the third kind"
161  * - @ref std::cyl_bessel_i
162  * "cyl_bessel_i - Regular modified cylindrical Bessel functions"
163  * - @ref std::cyl_bessel_j
164  * "cyl_bessel_j - Cylindrical Bessel functions of the first kind"
165  * - @ref std::cyl_bessel_k
166  * "cyl_bessel_k - Irregular modified cylindrical Bessel functions"
167  * - @ref std::cyl_neumann
168  * "cyl_neumann - Cylindrical Neumann functions or Cylindrical Bessel functions of the second kind"
169  * - @ref std::ellint_1
170  * "ellint_1 - Incomplete elliptic functions of the first kind"
171  * - @ref std::ellint_2
172  * "ellint_2 - Incomplete elliptic functions of the second kind"
173  * - @ref std::ellint_3
174  * "ellint_3 - Incomplete elliptic functions of the third kind"
175  * - @ref std::expint "expint - The exponential integral"
176  * - @ref std::hermite "hermite - Hermite polynomials"
177  * - @ref std::laguerre "laguerre - Laguerre functions"
178  * - @ref std::legendre "legendre - Legendre polynomials"
179  * - @ref std::riemann_zeta "riemann_zeta - The Riemann zeta function"
180  * - @ref std::sph_bessel "sph_bessel - Spherical Bessel functions"
181  * - @ref std::sph_legendre "sph_legendre - Spherical Legendre functions"
182  * - @ref std::sph_neumann "sph_neumann - Spherical Neumann functions"
183  *
184  * The hypergeometric functions were stricken from the TR29124 and C++17
185  * versions of this math library because of implementation concerns.
186  * However, since they were in the TR1 version and since they are popular
187  * we kept them as an extension in namespace @c __gnu_cxx:
188  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::conf_hyperg
189  * "conf_hyperg - Confluent hypergeometric functions"
190  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::hyperg "hyperg - Hypergeometric functions"
191  *
192  * In addition a large number of new functions are added as extensions:
193  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::airy_ai "airy_ai - Airy functions of the first kind"
194  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::airy_bi "airy_bi - Airy functions of the second kind"
195  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::bell "bell - Bell numbers and polynomials"
196  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::bernoulli "bernoulli - Bernoulli polynomials"
197  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::binomial "binomial - Binomial coefficients"
198  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::bose_einstein "bose_einstein - Bose-Einstein integrals"
199  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::chebyshev_t
200  * "chebyshev_t - Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind"
201  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::chebyshev_u
202  * "chebyshev_u - Chebyshev polynomials of the second kind"
203  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::chebyshev_v
204  * "chebyshev_v - Chebyshev polynomials of the third kind"
205  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::chebyshev_w
206  * "chebyshev_w - Chebyshev polynomials of the fourth kind"
207  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::clausen "clausen - Clausen integrals"
208  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::clausen_cl "clausen_cl - Clausen cosine integrals"
209  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::clausen_sl "clausen_sl - Clausen sine integrals"
210  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::comp_ellint_d
211  * "comp_ellint_d - Incomplete Legendre D elliptic integral"
212  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::conf_hyperg_lim
213  * "conf_hyperg_lim - Confluent hypergeometric limit functions"
214  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::cos_pi "cos_pi - Reperiodized cosine function."
215  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::cosh_pi
216  * "cosh_pi - Reperiodized hyperbolic cosine function."
217  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::coshint "coshint - Hyperbolic cosine integral"
218  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::cosint "cosint - Cosine integral"
219  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::cyl_hankel_1
220  * "cyl_hankel_1 - Cylindrical Hankel functions of the first kind"
221  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::cyl_hankel_2
222  * "cyl_hankel_2 - Cylindrical Hankel functions of the second kind"
223  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::dawson "dawson - Dawson integrals"
224  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::debye "debye - Debye functions"
225  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::digamma "digamma - Digamma or psi function"
226  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::dilog "dilog - Dilogarithm functions"
227  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::dirichlet_beta "dirichlet_beta - Dirichlet beta function"
228  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::dirichlet_eta "dirichlet_eta - Dirichlet beta function"
229  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::dirichlet_lambda
230  * "dirichlet_lambda - Dirichlet lambda function"
231  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::double_factorial "double_factorial - Double factorials"
232  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::ellint_d "ellint_d - Legendre D elliptic integrals"
233  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::ellint_rc "ellint_rc - Carlson elliptic functions R_C"
234  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::ellint_rd "ellint_rd - Carlson elliptic functions R_D"
235  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::ellint_rf "ellint_rf - Carlson elliptic functions R_F"
236  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::ellint_rg "ellint_rg - Carlson elliptic functions R_G"
237  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::ellint_rj "ellint_rj - Carlson elliptic functions R_J"
238  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::ellnome "ellnome - Elliptic nome"
239  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::euler "euler - Euler numbers"
240  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::euler "euler - Euler polynomials"
241  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::eulerian_1
242  * "eulerian_1 - Eulerian numbers of the first kind"
243  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::eulerian_2
244  * "eulerian_2 - Eulerian numbers of the second kind"
245  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::expint "expint - Exponential integrals"
246  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::factorial "factorial - Factorials"
247  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::falling_factorial
248  * "falling_factorial - Falling factorials"
249  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::fermi_dirac "fermi_dirac - Fermi-Dirac integrals"
250  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::fresnel_c "fresnel_c - Fresnel cosine integrals"
251  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::fresnel_s "fresnel_s - Fresnel sine integrals"
252  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::gamma_p
253  * "gamma_p - Regularized lower incomplete gamma functions"
254  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::gamma_q
255  * "gamma_q - Regularized upper incomplete gamma functions"
256  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::gamma_reciprocal
257  * "gamma_reciprocal - Reciprocal gamma function"
258  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::gegenbauer "gegenbauer - Gegenbauer polynomials"
259  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::heuman_lambda "heuman_lambda - Heuman lambda functions"
260  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::hurwitz_zeta "hurwitz_zeta - Hurwitz zeta functions"
261  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::ibeta "ibeta - Regularized incomplete beta functions"
262  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::jacobi "jacobi - Jacobi polynomials"
263  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::jacobi_sn "jacobi_sn - Jacobi sine amplitude functions"
264  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::jacobi_cn "jacobi_cn - Jacobi cosine amplitude functions"
265  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::jacobi_dn "jacobi_dn - Jacobi delta amplitude functions"
266  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::jacobi_theta_1 "theta_1 - Jacobi theta function 1"
267  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::jacobi_theta_2 "theta_2 - Jacobi theta function 2"
268  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::jacobi_theta_3 "theta_3 - Jacobi theta function 3"
269  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::jacobi_theta_4 "theta_4 - Jacobi theta function 4"
270  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::jacobi_zeta "jacobi_zeta - Jacobi zeta functions"
271  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::lah "lah - Lah numbers"
272  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::lbinomial "lbinomial - Log binomial coefficients"
273  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::ldouble_factorial
274  * "ldouble_factorial - Log double factorials"
275  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::legendre_q
276  * "legendre_q - Legendre functions of the second kind"
277  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::lerch_phi "lerch_phi - The Lerch transcendent"
278  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::lfactorial "lfactorial - Log factorials"
279  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::lfalling_factorial
280  * "lfalling_factorial - Log falling factorials"
281  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::lgamma "lgamma - Log gamma for complex arguments"
282  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::lrising_factorial
283  * "lrising_factorial - Log rising factorials"
284  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::mittag_leffler
285  * "mittag_leffler - Mittag-Leffler functions"
286  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::owens_t "owens_t - Owens T functions"
287  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::periodic_zeta "periodic_zeta - Periodic zeta functions"
288  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::radpoly "radpoly - Radial polynomials"
289  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::rising_factorial "rising_factorial - Rising factorials"
290  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sinhc "sinhc - Hyperbolic sinus cardinal function"
291  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sinhc_pi
292  * "sinhc_pi - Reperiodized hyperbolic sinus cardinal function"
293  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sinc "sinc - Normalized sinus cardinal function"
294  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sincos "sincos - Sine + cosine function"
295  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sincos_pi
296  * "sincos_pi - Reperiodized sine + cosine function"
297  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sin_pi "sin_pi - Reperiodized sine function."
298  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sinh_pi
299  * "sinh_pi - Reperiodized hyperbolic sine function."
300  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sinc_pi "sinc_pi - Sinus cardinal function"
301  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sinhint "sinhint - Hyperbolic sine integral"
302  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sinint "sinint - Sine integral"
303  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sph_bessel_i
304  * "sph_bessel_i - Spherical regular modified Bessel functions"
305  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sph_bessel_k
306  * "sph_bessel_k - Spherical iregular modified Bessel functions"
307  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sph_hankel_1
308  * "sph_hankel_1 - Spherical Hankel functions of the first kind"
309  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sph_hankel_2
310  * "sph_hankel_2 - Spherical Hankel functions of the first kind"
311  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::sph_harmonic "sph_harmonic - Spherical"
312  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::stirling_1
313  * "stirling_1 - Stirling numbers of the first kind"
314  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::stirling_2
315  * "stirling_2 - Stirling numbers of the second kind"
316  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::tan_pi "tan_pi - Reperiodized tangent function."
317  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::tanh_pi
318  * "tanh_pi - Reperiodized hyperbolic tangent function."
319  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::tgamma "tgamma - Gamma for complex arguments"
320  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::tgamma "tgamma - Upper incomplete gamma functions"
321  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::tgamma_lower
322  * "tgamma_lower - Lower incomplete gamma functions"
323  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::theta_1 "theta_1 - Exponential theta function 1"
324  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::theta_2 "theta_2 - Exponential theta function 2"
325  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::theta_3 "theta_3 - Exponential theta function 3"
326  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::theta_4 "theta_4 - Exponential theta function 4"
327  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::tricomi_u
328  * "tricomi_u - Tricomi confluent hypergeometric function"
329  * - @ref __gnu_cxx::zernike "zernike - Zernike polynomials"
330  *
331  * @section general General Features
332  *
333  * @subsection promotion Argument Promotion
334  * The arguments suppled to the non-suffixed functions will be promoted
335  * according to the following rules:
336  * 1. If any argument intended to be floating point is given an integral value
337  * That integral value is promoted to double.
338  * 2. All floating point arguments are promoted up to the largest floating
339  * point precision among them.
340  *
341  * @subsection NaN NaN Arguments
342  * If any of the floating point arguments supplied to these functions is
343  * invalid or NaN (std::numeric_limits<Tp>::quiet_NaN),
344  * the value NaN is returned.
345  *
346  * @section impl Implementation
347  *
348  * We strive to implement the underlying math with type generic algorithms
349  * to the greatest extent possible. In practice, the functions are thin
350  * wrappers that dispatch to function templates. Type dependence is
351  * controlled with std::numeric_limits and functions thereof.
352  *
353  * We don't promote @c float to @c double or @c double to <tt>long double</tt>
354  * reflexively. The goal is for @c float functions to operate more quickly,
355  * at the cost of @c float accuracy and possibly a smaller domain of validity.
356  * Similaryly, <tt>long double</tt> should give you more dynamic range
357  * and slightly more pecision than @c double on many systems.
358  *
359  * @section testing Testing
360  *
361  * These functions have been tested against equivalent implementations
362  * from the <a href="http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl">
363  * Gnu Scientific Library, GSL</a> and
364  * <a href="http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_60_0/libs/
365  * math/doc/html/index.html>Boost</a>
366  * and the ratio
367  * @f[
368  * \frac{|f - f_{test}|}{|f_{test}|}
369  * @f]
370  * is generally found to be within 10^-15 for 64-bit double
371  * on linux-x86_64 systems over most of the ranges of validity.
372  *
373  * @todo Provide accuracy comparisons on a per-function basis for a small
374  * number of targets.
375  *
376  * @section bibliography General Bibliography
377  *
378  * @see Abramowitz and Stegun: Handbook of Mathematical Functions,
379  * with Formulas, Graphs, and Mathematical Tables
380  * Edited by Milton Abramowitz and Irene A. Stegun,
381  * National Bureau of Standards Applied Mathematics Series - 55
382  * Issued June 1964, Tenth Printing, December 1972, with corrections
383  * Electronic versions of A&S abound including both pdf and navigable html.
384  * @see for example http://people.math.sfu.ca/~cbm/aands/
385  *
386  * @see The old A&S has been redone as the
387  * NIST Digital Library of Mathematical Functions: http://dlmf.nist.gov/
388  * This version is far more navigable and includes more recent work.
389  *
390  * @see An Atlas of Functions: with Equator, the Atlas Function Calculator
391  * 2nd Edition, by Oldham, Keith B., Myland, Jan, Spanier, Jerome
392  *
393  * @see Asymptotics and Special Functions by Frank W. J. Olver,
394  * Academic Press, 1974
395  *
396  * @see Numerical Recipes in C, The Art of Scientific Computing,
397  * by William H. Press, Second Ed., Saul A. Teukolsky,
398  * William T. Vetterling, and Brian P. Flannery,
399  * Cambridge University Press, 1992
400  *
401  * @see The Special Functions and Their Approximations: Volumes 1 and 2,
402  * by Yudell L. Luke, Academic Press, 1969
403  */
404 
405  /** @} */ // math_spec_func
406 
407  /**
408  * @defgroup cxx17_math_spec_func C++17/IS29124 Mathematical Special Functions
409  * @ingroup math_spec_func
410  *
411  * A collection of advanced mathematical special functions for C++17
412  * and IS29124.
413  * @{
414  */
415 
416  // Associated Laguerre polynomials
417 
418  /**
419  * Return the associated Laguerre polynomial @f$ L_n^{(m)}(x) @f$
420  * of order @f$ n @f$, degree @f$ m @f$, and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
421  *
422  * @see assoc_laguerre for more details.
423  */
424  inline float
425  assoc_laguerref(unsigned int __n, unsigned int __m, float __x)
426  { return __detail::__assoc_laguerre<float>(__n, __m, __x); }
427 
428  /**
429  * Return the associated Laguerre polynomial @f$ L_n^{(m)}(x) @f$
430  * of order @f$ n @f$, degree @f$ m @f$ and <tt>long double</tt>
431  * argument @f$ x @f$.
432  *
433  * @see assoc_laguerre for more details.
434  */
435  inline long double
436  assoc_laguerrel(unsigned int __n, unsigned int __m, long double __x)
437  { return __detail::__assoc_laguerre<long double>(__n, __m, __x); }
438 
439  /**
440  * Return the associated Laguerre polynomial @f$ L_n^{(m)}(x) @f$
441  * of nonnegative degree @f$ n @f$, nonnegative order @f$ m @f$
442  * and real argument @f$ x @f$.
443  *
444  * The associated Laguerre function of real order @f$ \alpha @f$,
445  * @f$ L_n^{(\alpha)}(x) @f$, is defined by
446  * @f[
447  * L_n^{(\alpha)}(x) = \frac{(\alpha + 1)_n}{n!}
448  * {}_1F_1(-n; \alpha + 1; x)
449  * @f]
450  * where @f$ (\alpha)_n @f$ is the Pochhammer symbol and
451  * @f$ {}_1F_1(a; c; x) @f$ is the confluent hypergeometric function.
452  *
453  * The associated Laguerre polynomial is defined for integral
454  * order @f$ \alpha = m @f$ by:
455  * @f[
456  * L_n^{(m)}(x) = (-1)^m \frac{d^m}{dx^m} L_{n + m}(x)
457  * @f]
458  * where the Laguerre polynomial is defined by:
459  * @f[
460  * L_n(x) = \frac{e^x}{n!} \frac{d^n}{dx^n} (x^ne^{-x})
461  * @f]
462  * and @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
463  * @see laguerre for details of the Laguerre function of degree @c n
464  *
465  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
466  * @param __n The degree of the Laguerre function, <tt>__n >= 0</tt>.
467  * @param __m The order of the Laguerre function, <tt>__m >= 0</tt>.
468  * @param __x The argument of the Laguerre function, <tt>__x >= 0</tt>.
469  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt>__x < 0</tt>.
470  */
471  template<typename _Tp>
472  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
473  assoc_laguerre(unsigned int __n, unsigned int __m, _Tp __x)
474  {
475  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
476  return __detail::__assoc_laguerre<__type>(__n, __m, __x);
477  }
478 
479  /**
480  * Return the associated Laguerre polynomial @f$ L_n^{(\alpha)}(x) @f$
481  * of nonnegative degree @f$ n @f$, order @f$ \alpha @f$
482  * and real argument @f$ x @f$.
483  *
484  * @tparam _Talpha The (signed integer or floating-point) type
485  * of the degree @c __alpha1.
486  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
487  */
488  template<typename _Talpha, typename _Tp>
489  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Talpha, _Tp>
490  assoc_laguerre(unsigned int __n, _Talpha __alpha1, _Tp __x)
491  {
492  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Talpha, _Tp>;
493  return __detail::__assoc_laguerre<__type>(__n, __alpha1, __x);
494  }
495 
496  // Associated Legendre functions
497 
498  /**
499  * Return the associated Legendre function @f$ P_l^m(x) @f$
500  * of degree @f$ l @f$, order @f$ m @f$, and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
501  *
502  * @see assoc_legendre for more details.
503  */
504  inline float
505  assoc_legendref(unsigned int __l, unsigned int __m, float __x)
506  { return __detail::__assoc_legendre_p<float>(__l, __m, __x).__P_lm; }
507 
508  /**
509  * Return the associated Legendre function @f$ P_l^m(x) @f$
510  * of degree @f$ l @f$, order @f$ m @f$, and @c <tt>long double</tt>
511  * argument @f$ x @f$.
512  *
513  * @see assoc_legendre for more details.
514  */
515  inline long double
516  assoc_legendrel(unsigned int __l, unsigned int __m, long double __x)
517  { return __detail::__assoc_legendre_p<long double>(__l, __m, __x).__P_lm; }
518 
519  /**
520  * Return the associated Legendre function @f$ P_l^m(x) @f$
521  * of degree @f$ l @f$, order @f$ m @f$, and real argument @f$ x @f$.
522  *
523  * The associated Legendre function is derived from the Legendre function
524  * @f$ P_l(x) @f$ by the Rodrigues formula:
525  * @f[
526  * P_l^m(x) = (1 - x^2)^{m/2}\frac{d^m}{dx^m}P_l(x)
527  * @f]
528  * @see legendre for details of the Legendre function of degree @c l
529  * @note @f$ P_l^m(x) = 0 @f$ if @f$ m > l @f$.
530  *
531  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
532  * @param __l The degree <tt>__l >= 0</tt>.
533  * @param __m The order <tt>__m</tt>.
534  * @param __x The argument, <tt>abs(__x) <= 1</tt>.
535  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt>abs(__x) > 1</tt>.
536  */
537  template<typename _Tp>
538  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
539  assoc_legendre(unsigned int __l, unsigned int __m, _Tp __x)
540  {
541  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
542  return __detail::__assoc_legendre_p<__type>(__l, __m, __x).__P_lm;
543  }
544 
545  // Beta functions
546 
547  /**
548  * Return the beta function, @f$ B(a,b) @f$, for @c float parameters @f$ a @f$, @f$ b @f$.
549  *
550  * @see beta for more details.
551  */
552  inline float
553  betaf(float __a, float __b)
554  { return __detail::__beta<float>(__a, __b); }
555 
556  /**
557  * Return the beta function, @f$B(a,b)@f$, for long double
558  * parameters @f$ a @f$, @f$ b @f$.
559  *
560  * @see beta for more details.
561  */
562  inline long double
563  betal(long double __a, long double __b)
564  { return __detail::__beta<long double>(__a, __b); }
565 
566  /**
567  * Return the beta function, @f$B(a,b)@f$, for real parameters
568  * @f$ a @f$, @f$ b @f$.
569  *
570  * The beta function is defined by
571  * @f[
572  * B(a,b) = \int_0^1 t^{a - 1} (1 - t)^{b - 1} dt
573  * = \frac{\Gamma(a)\Gamma(b)}{\Gamma(a+b)}
574  * @f]
575  * where @f$ a > 0 @f$ and @f$ b > 0 @f$
576  *
577  * @tparam _Tpa The floating-point type of the parameter @c __a.
578  * @tparam _Tpb The floating-point type of the parameter @c __b.
579  * @param __a The first argument of the beta function, <tt> __a > 0 </tt>.
580  * @param __b The second argument of the beta function, <tt> __b > 0 </tt>.
581  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> __a < 0 </tt> or <tt> __b < 0 </tt>.
582  */
583  template<typename _Tpa, typename _Tpb>
584  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpa, _Tpb>
585  beta(_Tpa __a, _Tpb __b)
586  {
587  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpa, _Tpb>;
588  return __detail::__beta<__type>(__a, __b);
589  }
590 
591  // Complete elliptic integrals of the first kind
592 
593  /**
594  * Return the complete elliptic integral of the first kind @f$ E(k) @f$
595  * for @c float modulus @f$ k @f$.
596  *
597  * @see comp_ellint_1 for details.
598  */
599  inline float
600  comp_ellint_1f(float __k)
601  { return __detail::__comp_ellint_1<float>(__k); }
602 
603  /**
604  * Return the complete elliptic integral of the first kind @f$ E(k) @f$
605  * for <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$.
606  *
607  * @see comp_ellint_1 for details.
608  */
609  inline long double
610  comp_ellint_1l(long double __k)
611  { return __detail::__comp_ellint_1<long double>(__k); }
612 
613  /**
614  * Return the complete elliptic integral of the first kind
615  * @f$ K(k) @f$ for real modulus @f$ k @f$.
616  *
617  * The complete elliptic integral of the first kind is defined as
618  * @f[
619  * K(k) = F(k,\pi/2) = \int_0^{\pi/2}\frac{d\theta}
620  * {\sqrt{1 - k^2 sin^2\theta}}
621  * @f]
622  * where @f$ F(k,\phi) @f$ is the incomplete elliptic integral of the
623  * first kind and the modulus @f$ |k| <= 1 @f$.
624  * @see ellint_1 for details of the incomplete elliptic function
625  * of the first kind.
626  *
627  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the modulus @c __k.
628  * @param __k The modulus, <tt> abs(__k) <= 1 </tt>
629  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> abs(__k) > 1 </tt>.
630  */
631  template<typename _Tp>
632  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
633  comp_ellint_1(_Tp __k)
634  {
635  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
636  return __detail::__comp_ellint_1<__type>(__k);
637  }
638 
639  // Complete elliptic integrals of the second kind
640 
641  /**
642  * Return the complete elliptic integral of the second kind @f$ E(k) @f$
643  * for @c float modulus @f$ k @f$.
644  *
645  * @see comp_ellint_2 for details.
646  */
647  inline float
648  comp_ellint_2f(float __k)
649  { return __detail::__comp_ellint_2<float>(__k); }
650 
651  /**
652  * Return the complete elliptic integral of the second kind @f$ E(k) @f$
653  * for <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$.
654  *
655  * @see comp_ellint_2 for details.
656  */
657  inline long double
658  comp_ellint_2l(long double __k)
659  { return __detail::__comp_ellint_2<long double>(__k); }
660 
661  /**
662  * Return the complete elliptic integral of the second kind @f$ E(k) @f$
663  * for real modulus @f$ k @f$.
664  *
665  * The complete elliptic integral of the second kind is defined as
666  * @f[
667  * E(k) = E(k,\pi/2) = \int_0^{\pi/2}\sqrt{1 - k^2 sin^2\theta}
668  * @f]
669  * where @f$ E(k,\phi) @f$ is the incomplete elliptic integral of the
670  * second kind and the modulus @f$ |k| <= 1 @f$.
671  * @see ellint_2 for details of the incomplete elliptic function
672  * of the second kind.
673  *
674  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the modulus @c __k.
675  * @param __k The modulus, @c abs(__k) <= 1
676  * @throw std::domain_error if @c abs(__k) > 1.
677  */
678  template<typename _Tp>
679  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
680  comp_ellint_2(_Tp __k)
681  {
682  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
683  return __detail::__comp_ellint_2<__type>(__k);
684  }
685 
686  // Complete elliptic integrals of the third kind
687 
688  /**
689  * @brief Return the complete elliptic integral of the third kind
690  * @f$ \Pi(k,\nu) @f$ for @c float modulus @f$ k @f$.
691  *
692  * @see comp_ellint_3 for details.
693  */
694  inline float
695  comp_ellint_3f(float __k, float __nu)
696  { return __detail::__comp_ellint_3<float>(__k, __nu); }
697 
698  /**
699  * @brief Return the complete elliptic integral of the third kind
700  * @f$ \Pi(k,\nu) @f$ for <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$.
701  *
702  * @see comp_ellint_3 for details.
703  */
704  inline long double
705  comp_ellint_3l(long double __k, long double __nu)
706  { return __detail::__comp_ellint_3<long double>(__k, __nu); }
707 
708  /**
709  * Return the complete elliptic integral of the third kind
710  * @f$ \Pi(k,\nu) = \Pi(k,\nu,\pi/2) @f$ for real modulus @f$ k @f$.
711  *
712  * The complete elliptic integral of the third kind is defined as
713  * @f[
714  * \Pi(k,\nu) = \Pi(k,\nu,\pi/2) = \int_0^{\pi/2}
715  * \frac{d\theta}
716  * {(1 - \nu \sin^2\theta)\sqrt{1 - k^2 \sin^2\theta}}
717  * @f]
718  * where @f$ \Pi(k,\nu,\phi) @f$ is the incomplete elliptic integral of the
719  * second kind and the modulus @f$ |k| <= 1 @f$.
720  * @see ellint_3 for details of the incomplete elliptic function
721  * of the third kind.
722  *
723  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the modulus @c __k.
724  * @tparam _Tpn The floating-point type of the argument @c __nu.
725  * @param __k The modulus, @c abs(__k) <= 1.
726  * @param __nu The characteristic.
727  * @throw std::domain_error if @c abs(__k) > 1.
728  */
729  template<typename _Tp, typename _Tpn>
730  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tpn>
731  comp_ellint_3(_Tp __k, _Tpn __nu)
732  {
733  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tpn>;
734  return __detail::__comp_ellint_3<__type>(__k, __nu);
735  }
736 
737  // Regular modified cylindrical Bessel functions
738 
739  /**
740  * Return the regular modified Bessel function @f$ I_{\nu}(x) @f$
741  * for @c float order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
742  *
743  * @see cyl_bessel_i for setails.
744  */
745  inline float
746  cyl_bessel_if(float __nu, float __x)
747  { return __detail::__cyl_bessel_i<float>(__nu, __x); }
748 
749  /**
750  * Return the regular modified Bessel function @f$ I_{\nu}(x) @f$
751  * for <tt>long double</tt> order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
752  *
753  * @see cyl_bessel_i for setails.
754  */
755  inline long double
756  cyl_bessel_il(long double __nu, long double __x)
757  { return __detail::__cyl_bessel_i<long double>(__nu, __x); }
758 
759  /**
760  * Return the regular modified Bessel function @f$ I_{\nu}(x) @f$
761  * for real order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
762  *
763  * The regular modified cylindrical Bessel function is:
764  * @f[
765  * I_{\nu}(x) = i^{-\nu}J_\nu(ix) = \sum_{k=0}^{\infty}
766  * \frac{(x/2)^{\nu + 2k}}{k!\Gamma(\nu+k+1)}
767  * @f]
768  *
769  * @tparam _Tpnu The floating-point type of the order @c __nu.
770  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
771  * @param __nu The order
772  * @param __x The argument, <tt> __x >= 0 </tt>
773  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> __x < 0 </tt>.
774  */
775  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
776  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>
777  cyl_bessel_i(_Tpnu __nu, _Tp __x)
778  {
779  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
780  return __detail::__cyl_bessel_i<__type>(__nu, __x);
781  }
782 
783  // Cylindrical Bessel functions (of the first kind)
784 
785  /**
786  * Return the Bessel function of the first kind @f$ J_{\nu}(x) @f$
787  * for @c float order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
788  *
789  * @see cyl_bessel_j for setails.
790  */
791  inline float
792  cyl_bessel_jf(float __nu, float __x)
793  { return __detail::__cyl_bessel_j<float>(__nu, __x); }
794 
795  /**
796  * Return the Bessel function of the first kind @f$ J_{\nu}(x) @f$
797  * for <tt>long double</tt> order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
798  *
799  * @see cyl_bessel_j for setails.
800  */
801  inline long double
802  cyl_bessel_jl(long double __nu, long double __x)
803  { return __detail::__cyl_bessel_j<long double>(__nu, __x); }
804 
805  /**
806  * Return the Bessel function @f$ J_{\nu}(x) @f$ of real order @f$ \nu @f$
807  * and argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
808  *
809  * The cylindrical Bessel function is:
810  * @f[
811  * J_{\nu}(x) = \sum_{k=0}^{\infty}
812  * \frac{(-1)^k (x/2)^{\nu + 2k}}{k!\Gamma(\nu+k+1)}
813  * @f]
814  *
815  * @tparam _Tpnu The floating-point type of the order @c __nu.
816  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
817  * @param __nu The order
818  * @param __x The argument, <tt> __x >= 0 </tt>
819  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> __x < 0 </tt>.
820  */
821  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
822  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>
823  cyl_bessel_j(_Tpnu __nu, _Tp __x)
824  {
825  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
826  return __detail::__cyl_bessel_j<__type>(__nu, __x);
827  }
828 
829  // Irregular modified cylindrical Bessel functions
830 
831  /**
832  * Return the irregular modified Bessel function @f$ K_{\nu}(x) @f$
833  * for @c float order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
834  *
835  * @see cyl_bessel_k for setails.
836  */
837  inline float
838  cyl_bessel_kf(float __nu, float __x)
839  { return __detail::__cyl_bessel_k<float>(__nu, __x); }
840 
841  /**
842  * Return the irregular modified Bessel function @f$ K_{\nu}(x) @f$
843  * for <tt>long double</tt> order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
844  *
845  * @see cyl_bessel_k for setails.
846  */
847  inline long double
848  cyl_bessel_kl(long double __nu, long double __x)
849  { return __detail::__cyl_bessel_k<long double>(__nu, __x); }
850 
851  /**
852  * Return the irregular modified Bessel function @f$ K_{\nu}(x) @f$
853  * of real order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
854  *
855  * The irregular modified Bessel function is defined by:
856  * @f[
857  * K_{\nu}(x) = \frac{\pi}{2}
858  * \frac{I_{-\nu}(x) - I_{\nu}(x)}{\sin \nu\pi}
859  * @f]
860  * where for integral @f$ \nu = n @f$ a limit is taken:
861  * @f$ lim_{\nu \to n} @f$.
862  * For negative argument we have simply:
863  * @f[
864  * K_{-\nu}(x) = K_{\nu}(x)
865  * @f]
866  *
867  * @tparam _Tpnu The floating-point type of the order @c __nu.
868  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
869  * @param __nu The order
870  * @param __x The argument, <tt> __x >= 0 </tt>
871  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> __x < 0 </tt>.
872  */
873  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
874  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>
875  cyl_bessel_k(_Tpnu __nu, _Tp __x)
876  {
877  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
878  return __detail::__cyl_bessel_k<__type>(__nu, __x);
879  }
880 
881  // Cylindrical Neumann functions
882 
883  /**
884  * Return the Neumann function @f$ N_{\nu}(x) @f$
885  * of @c float order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
886  *
887  * @see cyl_neumann for setails.
888  */
889  inline float
890  cyl_neumannf(float __nu, float __x)
891  { return __detail::__cyl_neumann_n<float>(__nu, __x); }
892 
893  /**
894  * Return the Neumann function @f$ N_{\nu}(x) @f$
895  * of <tt>long double</tt> order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
896  *
897  * @see cyl_neumann for setails.
898  */
899  inline long double
900  cyl_neumannl(long double __nu, long double __x)
901  { return __detail::__cyl_neumann_n<long double>(__nu, __x); }
902 
903  /**
904  * Return the Neumann function @f$ N_{\nu}(x) @f$
905  * of real order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
906  *
907  * The Neumann function is defined by:
908  * @f[
909  * N_{\nu}(x) = \frac{J_{\nu}(x) \cos \nu\pi - J_{-\nu}(x)}
910  * {\sin \nu\pi}
911  * @f]
912  * where @f$ x >= 0 @f$ and for integral order @f$ \nu = n @f$
913  * a limit is taken: @f$ lim_{\nu \to n} @f$.
914  *
915  * @tparam _Tpnu The floating-point type of the order @c __nu.
916  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
917  * @param __nu The order.
918  * @param __x The argument, <tt> __x >= 0 </tt>.
919  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> __x < 0 </tt>.
920  */
921  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
922  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>
923  cyl_neumann(_Tpnu __nu, _Tp __x)
924  {
925  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
926  return __detail::__cyl_neumann_n<__type>(__nu, __x);
927  }
928 
929  // Incomplete elliptic integrals of the first kind
930 
931  /**
932  * Return the incomplete elliptic integral of the first kind @f$ E(k,\phi) @f$
933  * for @c float modulus @f$ k @f$ and angle @f$ \phi @f$.
934  *
935  * @see ellint_1 for details.
936  */
937  inline float
938  ellint_1f(float __k, float __phi)
939  { return __detail::__ellint_1<float>(__k, __phi); }
940 
941  /**
942  * Return the incomplete elliptic integral of the first kind @f$ E(k,\phi) @f$
943  * for <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$ and angle @f$ \phi @f$.
944  *
945  * @see ellint_1 for details.
946  */
947  inline long double
948  ellint_1l(long double __k, long double __phi)
949  { return __detail::__ellint_1<long double>(__k, __phi); }
950 
951  /**
952  * Return the incomplete elliptic integral of the first kind @f$ F(k,\phi) @f$
953  * for @c real modulus @f$ k @f$ and angle @f$ \phi @f$.
954  *
955  * The incomplete elliptic integral of the first kind is defined as
956  * @f[
957  * F(k,\phi) = \int_0^{\phi}\frac{d\theta}
958  * {\sqrt{1 - k^2 sin^2\theta}}
959  * @f]
960  * For @f$ \phi= \pi/2 @f$ this becomes the complete elliptic integral of
961  * the first kind, @f$ K(k) @f$. @see comp_ellint_1.
962  *
963  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the modulus @c __k.
964  * @tparam _Tpp The floating-point type of the angle @c __phi.
965  * @param __k The modulus, <tt> abs(__k) <= 1 </tt>.
966  * @param __phi The integral limit argument in radians.
967  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> abs(__k) > 1 </tt>.
968  */
969  template<typename _Tp, typename _Tpp>
970  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tpp>
971  ellint_1(_Tp __k, _Tpp __phi)
972  {
973  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tpp>;
974  return __detail::__ellint_1<__type>(__k, __phi);
975  }
976 
977  // Incomplete elliptic integrals of the second kind
978 
979  /**
980  * @brief Return the incomplete elliptic integral of the second kind
981  * @f$ E(k,\phi) @f$ for @c float argument.
982  *
983  * @see ellint_2 for details.
984  */
985  inline float
986  ellint_2f(float __k, float __phi)
987  { return __detail::__ellint_2<float>(__k, __phi); }
988 
989  /**
990  * @brief Return the incomplete elliptic integral of the second kind
991  * @f$ E(k,\phi) @f$.
992  *
993  * @see ellint_2 for details.
994  */
995  inline long double
996  ellint_2l(long double __k, long double __phi)
997  { return __detail::__ellint_2<long double>(__k, __phi); }
998 
999  /**
1000  * Return the incomplete elliptic integral of the second kind
1001  * @f$ E(k,\phi) @f$.
1002  *
1003  * The incomplete elliptic integral of the second kind is defined as
1004  * @f[
1005  * E(k,\phi) = \int_0^{\phi} \sqrt{1 - k^2 sin^2\theta}
1006  * @f]
1007  * For @f$ \phi= \pi/2 @f$ this becomes the complete elliptic integral of
1008  * the second kind, @f$ E(k) @f$. @see comp_ellint_2.
1009  *
1010  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the modulus @c __k.
1011  * @tparam _Tpp The floating-point type of the angle @c __phi.
1012  * @param __k The modulus, <tt> abs(__k) <= 1 </tt>
1013  * @param __phi The integral limit argument in radians
1014  * @return The elliptic function of the second kind.
1015  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> abs(__k) > 1 </tt>.
1016  */
1017  template<typename _Tp, typename _Tpp>
1018  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tpp>
1019  ellint_2(_Tp __k, _Tpp __phi)
1020  {
1021  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tpp>;
1022  return __detail::__ellint_2<__type>(__k, __phi);
1023  }
1024 
1025  // Incomplete elliptic integrals of the third kind
1026 
1027  /**
1028  * @brief Return the incomplete elliptic integral of the third kind
1029  * @f$ \Pi(k,\nu,\phi) @f$ for @c float argument.
1030  *
1031  * @see ellint_3 for details.
1032  */
1033  inline float
1034  ellint_3f(float __k, float __nu, float __phi)
1035  { return __detail::__ellint_3<float>(__k, __nu, __phi); }
1036 
1037  /**
1038  * @brief Return the incomplete elliptic integral of the third kind
1039  * @f$ \Pi(k,\nu,\phi) @f$.
1040  *
1041  * @see ellint_3 for details.
1042  */
1043  inline long double
1044  ellint_3l(long double __k, long double __nu, long double __phi)
1045  { return __detail::__ellint_3<long double>(__k, __nu, __phi); }
1046 
1047  /**
1048  * @brief Return the incomplete elliptic integral of the third kind
1049  * @f$ \Pi(k,\nu,\phi) @f$.
1050  *
1051  * The incomplete elliptic integral of the third kind is defined by:
1052  * @f[
1053  * \Pi(k,\nu,\phi) = \int_0^{\phi}
1054  * \frac{d\theta}
1055  * {(1 - \nu \sin^2\theta)
1056  * \sqrt{1 - k^2 \sin^2\theta}}
1057  * @f]
1058  * For @f$ \phi= \pi/2 @f$ this becomes the complete elliptic integral of
1059  * the third kind, @f$ \Pi(k,\nu) @f$. @see comp_ellint_3.
1060  *
1061  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the modulus @c __k.
1062  * @tparam _Tpn The floating-point type of the argument @c __nu.
1063  * @tparam _Tpp The floating-point type of the angle @c __phi.
1064  * @param __k The modulus, <tt> abs(__k) <= 1 </tt>.
1065  * @param __nu The characteristic.
1066  * @param __phi The integral limit argument in radians.
1067  * @return The elliptic function of the third kind.
1068  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> abs(__k) > 1 </tt>.
1069  */
1070  template<typename _Tp, typename _Tpn, typename _Tpp>
1071  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tpn, _Tpp>
1072  ellint_3(_Tp __k, _Tpn __nu, _Tpp __phi)
1073  {
1074  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tpn, _Tpp>;
1075  return __detail::__ellint_3<__type>(__k, __nu, __phi);
1076  }
1077 
1078  // Exponential integrals
1079 
1080  /**
1081  * Return the exponential integral @f$ Ei(x) @f$ for @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
1082  *
1083  * @see expint for details.
1084  */
1085  inline float
1086  expintf(float __x)
1087  { return __detail::__expint<float>(__x); }
1088 
1089  /**
1090  * Return the exponential integral @f$ Ei(x) @f$
1091  * for <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
1092  *
1093  * @see expint for details.
1094  */
1095  inline long double
1096  expintl(long double __x)
1097  { return __detail::__expint<long double>(__x); }
1098 
1099  /**
1100  * Return the exponential integral @f$ Ei(x) @f$ for @c real argument @f$ x @f$.
1101  *
1102  * The exponential integral is given by
1103  * \f[
1104  * Ei(x) = -\int_{-x}^\infty \frac{e^t}{t} dt
1105  * \f]
1106  *
1107  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
1108  * @param __x The argument of the exponential integral function.
1109  */
1110  template<typename _Tp>
1111  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1112  expint(_Tp __x)
1113  {
1114  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1115  return __detail::__expint<__type>(__x);
1116  }
1117 
1118  // Hermite polynomials
1119 
1120  /**
1121  * Return the Hermite polynomial @f$ H_n(x) @f$ of nonnegative order n
1122  * and float argument @f$ x @f$.
1123  *
1124  * @see hermite for details.
1125  */
1126  inline float
1127  hermitef(unsigned int __n, float __x)
1128  { return __detail::__hermite<float>(__n, __x); }
1129 
1130  /**
1131  * Return the Hermite polynomial @f$ H_n(x) @f$ of nonnegative order n
1132  * and <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
1133  *
1134  * @see hermite for details.
1135  */
1136  inline long double
1137  hermitel(unsigned int __n, long double __x)
1138  { return __detail::__hermite<long double>(__n, __x); }
1139 
1140  /**
1141  * Return the Hermite polynomial @f$ H_n(x) @f$ of order n
1142  * and @c real argument @f$ x @f$.
1143  *
1144  * The Hermite polynomial is defined by:
1145  * @f[
1146  * H_n(x) = (-1)^n e^{x^2} \frac{d^n}{dx^n} e^{-x^2}
1147  * @f]
1148  *
1149  * The Hermite polynomial obeys a reflection formula:
1150  * @f[
1151  * H_n(-x) = (-1)^n H_n(x)
1152  * @f]
1153  *
1154  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
1155  * @param __n The order
1156  * @param __x The argument
1157  */
1158  template<typename _Tp>
1159  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1160  hermite(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
1161  {
1162  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1163  return __detail::__hermite<__type>(__n, __x);
1164  }
1165 
1166  // Laguerre polynomials
1167 
1168  /**
1169  * Returns the Laguerre polynomial @f$ L_n(x) @f$ of nonnegative degree @c n
1170  * and @c float argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
1171  *
1172  * @see laguerre for more details.
1173  */
1174  inline float
1175  laguerref(unsigned int __n, float __x)
1176  { return __detail::__laguerre<float>(__n, __x); }
1177 
1178  /**
1179  * Returns the Laguerre polynomial @f$ L_n(x) @f$ of nonnegative degree @c n
1180  * and <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
1181  *
1182  * @see laguerre for more details.
1183  */
1184  inline long double
1185  laguerrel(unsigned int __n, long double __x)
1186  { return __detail::__laguerre<long double>(__n, __x); }
1187 
1188  /**
1189  * Returns the Laguerre polynomial @f$ L_n(x) @f$
1190  * of nonnegative degree @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
1191  *
1192  * The Laguerre polynomial is defined by:
1193  * @f[
1194  * L_n(x) = \frac{e^x}{n!} \frac{d^n}{dx^n} (x^ne^{-x})
1195  * @f]
1196  *
1197  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
1198  * @param __n The nonnegative order
1199  * @param __x The argument <tt> __x >= 0 </tt>
1200  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> __x < 0 </tt>.
1201  */
1202  template<typename _Tp>
1203  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1204  laguerre(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
1205  {
1206  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1207  return __detail::__laguerre<__type>(__n, __x);
1208  }
1209 
1210  // Legendre polynomials
1211 
1212  /**
1213  * Return the Legendre polynomial @f$ P_l(x) @f$ of nonnegative
1214  * degree @f$ l @f$ and @c float argument @f$ |x| <= 0 @f$.
1215  *
1216  * @see legendre for more details.
1217  */
1218  inline float
1219  legendref(unsigned int __l, float __x)
1220  { return __detail::__legendre_p<float>(__l, __x).__P_l; }
1221 
1222  /**
1223  * Return the Legendre polynomial @f$ P_l(x) @f$ of nonnegative
1224  * degree @f$ l @f$ and <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ |x| <= 0 @f$.
1225  *
1226  * @see legendre for more details.
1227  */
1228  inline long double
1229  legendrel(unsigned int __l, long double __x)
1230  { return __detail::__legendre_p<long double>(__l, __x).__P_l; }
1231 
1232  /**
1233  * Return the Legendre polynomial @f$ P_l(x) @f$ of nonnegative
1234  * degree @f$ l @f$ and real argument @f$ |x| <= 0 @f$.
1235  *
1236  * The Legendre function of order @f$ l @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$,
1237  * @f$ P_l(x) @f$, is defined by:
1238  * @f[
1239  * P_l(x) = \frac{1}{2^l l!}\frac{d^l}{dx^l}(x^2 - 1)^{l}
1240  * @f]
1241  *
1242  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
1243  * @param __l The degree @f$ l >= 0 @f$
1244  * @param __x The argument @c abs(__x) <= 1
1245  * @throw std::domain_error if @c abs(__x) > 1
1246  */
1247  template<typename _Tp>
1248  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1249  legendre(unsigned int __l, _Tp __x)
1250  {
1251  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1252  return __detail::__legendre_p<__type>(__l, __x).__P_l;
1253  }
1254 
1255  // Riemann zeta functions
1256 
1257  /**
1258  * Return the Riemann zeta function @f$ \zeta(s) @f$
1259  * for @c float argument @f$ s @f$.
1260  *
1261  * @see riemann_zeta for more details.
1262  */
1263  inline float
1264  riemann_zetaf(float __s)
1265  { return __detail::__riemann_zeta<float>(__s); }
1266 
1267  /**
1268  * Return the Riemann zeta function @f$ \zeta(s) @f$
1269  * for <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ s @f$.
1270  *
1271  * @see riemann_zeta for more details.
1272  */
1273  inline long double
1274  riemann_zetal(long double __s)
1275  { return __detail::__riemann_zeta<long double>(__s); }
1276 
1277  /**
1278  * Return the Riemann zeta function @f$ \zeta(s) @f$
1279  * for real argument @f$ s @f$.
1280  *
1281  * The Riemann zeta function is defined by:
1282  * @f[
1283  * \zeta(s) = \sum_{k=1}^{\infty} k^{-s} \mbox{ for } s > 1
1284  * @f]
1285  * and
1286  * @f[
1287  * \zeta(s) = \frac{1}{1-2^{1-s}}\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}(-1)^{k-1}k^{-s}
1288  * \mbox{ for } 0 <= s < 1
1289  * @f]
1290  * For s < 1 use the reflection formula:
1291  * @f[
1292  * \zeta(s) = 2^s \pi^{s-1} \sin(\frac{\pi s}{2}) \Gamma(1-s) \zeta(1-s)
1293  * @f]
1294  *
1295  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __s.
1296  * @param __s The order <tt> s != 1 </tt>
1297  */
1298  template<typename _Tp>
1299  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1300  riemann_zeta(_Tp __s)
1301  {
1302  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1303  return __detail::__riemann_zeta<__type>(__s);
1304  }
1305 
1306  // Spherical Bessel functions
1307 
1308  /**
1309  * Return the spherical Bessel function @f$ j_n(x) @f$ of nonnegative order n
1310  * and @c float argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
1311  *
1312  * @see sph_bessel for more details.
1313  */
1314  inline float
1315  sph_besself(unsigned int __n, float __x)
1316  { return __detail::__sph_bessel<float>(__n, __x); }
1317 
1318  /**
1319  * Return the spherical Bessel function @f$ j_n(x) @f$ of nonnegative order n
1320  * and <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
1321  *
1322  * @see sph_bessel for more details.
1323  */
1324  inline long double
1325  sph_bessell(unsigned int __n, long double __x)
1326  { return __detail::__sph_bessel<long double>(__n, __x); }
1327 
1328  /**
1329  * Return the spherical Bessel function @f$ j_n(x) @f$ of nonnegative order n
1330  * and real argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
1331  *
1332  * The spherical Bessel function is defined by:
1333  * @f[
1334  * j_n(x) = \left(\frac{\pi}{2x} \right) ^{1/2} J_{n+1/2}(x)
1335  * @f]
1336  *
1337  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
1338  * @param __n The integral order <tt> n >= 0 </tt>
1339  * @param __x The real argument <tt> x >= 0 </tt>
1340  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> __x < 0 </tt>.
1341  */
1342  template<typename _Tp>
1343  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1344  sph_bessel(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
1345  {
1346  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1347  return __detail::__sph_bessel<__type>(__n, __x);
1348  }
1349 
1350  // Spherical associated Legendre functions
1351 
1352  /**
1353  * Return the spherical Legendre function of nonnegative integral
1354  * degree @f$ l @f$ and order @f$ m @f$ and float angle @f$ \theta @f$ in radians.
1355  *
1356  * @see sph_legendre for details.
1357  */
1358  inline float
1359  sph_legendref(unsigned int __l, unsigned int __m, float __theta)
1360  { return __detail::__sph_legendre<float>(__l, __m, __theta); }
1361 
1362  /**
1363  * Return the spherical Legendre function of nonnegative integral
1364  * degree @f$ l @f$ and order @f$ m @f$ and <tt>long double</tt> angle @f$ \theta @f$
1365  * in radians.
1366  *
1367  * @see sph_legendre for details.
1368  */
1369  inline long double
1370  sph_legendrel(unsigned int __l, unsigned int __m, long double __theta)
1371  { return __detail::__sph_legendre<long double>(__l, __m, __theta); }
1372 
1373  /**
1374  * Return the spherical Legendre function of nonnegative integral
1375  * degree @f$ l @f$ and order @f$ m @f$ and real angle @f$ \theta @f$
1376  * in radians.
1377  *
1378  * The spherical Legendre function is defined by
1379  * @f[
1380  * Y_l^m(\theta,0) = (-1)^m\frac{(2l+1)}{4\pi} \frac{(l-m)!}{(l+m)!}
1381  * P_l^m(\cos\theta) e^{im\phi}
1382  * @f]
1383  * where @f$ P_l^m(x) @f$ is the associated Legendre polynomial.
1384  * The full (complex) spherical harmonic function includes a phase factor
1385  * in the azimuthal angle @f$ \phi @f$:
1386  * @f[
1387  * Y_l^m(\theta,\phi) = Y_l^m(\theta,0) e^{im\phi}
1388  * @f]
1389  *
1390  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the angle @c __theta.
1391  * @param __l The order <tt> __l >= 0 </tt>
1392  * @param __m The degree <tt> __m >= 0 </tt> and <tt> __m <= __l </tt>
1393  * @param __theta The radian polar angle argument
1394  * @see assoc_legendre for the unnormalized associated Legendre polynomial.
1395  */
1396  template<typename _Tp>
1397  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1398  sph_legendre(unsigned int __l, unsigned int __m, _Tp __theta)
1399  {
1400  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1401  return __detail::__sph_legendre<__type>(__l, __m, __theta);
1402  }
1403 
1404  // Spherical Neumann functions
1405 
1406  /**
1407  * Return the spherical Neumann function of integral order @f$ n >= 0 @f$
1408  * and @c float argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
1409  *
1410  * @see sph_neumann for details.
1411  */
1412  inline float
1413  sph_neumannf(unsigned int __n, float __x)
1414  { return __detail::__sph_neumann<float>(__n, __x); }
1415 
1416  /**
1417  * Return the spherical Neumann function of integral order @f$ n >= 0 @f$
1418  * and <tt>long double</tt> @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
1419  *
1420  * @see sph_neumann for details.
1421  */
1422  inline long double
1423  sph_neumannl(unsigned int __n, long double __x)
1424  { return __detail::__sph_neumann<long double>(__n, __x); }
1425 
1426  /**
1427  * Return the spherical Neumann function of integral order @f$ n >= 0 @f$
1428  * and real argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$.
1429  *
1430  * The spherical Neumann function is defined by
1431  * @f[
1432  * n_n(x) = \left(\frac{\pi}{2x} \right) ^{1/2} N_{n+1/2}(x)
1433  * @f]
1434  *
1435  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
1436  * @param __n The integral order <tt> n >= 0 </tt>
1437  * @param __x The real argument <tt> __x >= 0 </tt>
1438  * @throw std::domain_error if <tt> __x < 0 </tt>.
1439  */
1440  template<typename _Tp>
1441  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1442  sph_neumann(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
1443  {
1444  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1445  return __detail::__sph_neumann<__type>(__n, __x);
1446  }
1447 
1448  /** @} */ // cxx17_math_spec_func
1449 
1450 _GLIBCXX_END_NAMESPACE_VERSION
1451 } // namespace std
1452 
1453 namespace __gnu_cxx _GLIBCXX_VISIBILITY(default)
1454 {
1455 _GLIBCXX_BEGIN_NAMESPACE_VERSION
1456 
1457  /**
1458  * @defgroup gnu_math_spec_func GNU Extended Mathematical Special Functions
1459  * @ingroup math_spec_func
1460  *
1461  * An extended collection of advanced mathematical special functions for GNU.
1462  * @{
1463  */
1464 
1465  // Confluent hypergeometric functions
1466 
1467  /**
1468  * Return the confluent hypergeometric function @f$ {}_1F_1(a;c;x) @f$
1469  * of @c float numerator parameter @f$ a @f$, denominator parameter @f$ c @f$,
1470  * and argument @f$ x @f$.
1471  *
1472  * @see conf_hyperg for details.
1473  */
1474  inline float
1475  conf_hypergf(float __a, float __c, float __x)
1476  { return std::__detail::__conf_hyperg<float>(__a, __c, __x); }
1477 
1478  /**
1479  * Return the confluent hypergeometric function @f$ {}_1F_1(a;c;x) @f$
1480  * of <tt>long double</tt> numerator parameter @f$ a @f$,
1481  * denominator parameter @f$ c @f$, and argument @f$ x @f$.
1482  *
1483  * @see conf_hyperg for details.
1484  */
1485  inline long double
1486  conf_hypergl(long double __a, long double __c, long double __x)
1487  { return std::__detail::__conf_hyperg<long double>(__a, __c, __x); }
1488 
1489  /**
1490  * Return the confluent hypergeometric function @f$ {}_1F_1(a;c;x) @f$
1491  * of real numerator parameter @f$ a @f$, denominator parameter @f$ c @f$,
1492  * and argument @f$ x @f$.
1493  *
1494  * The confluent hypergeometric function is defined by
1495  * @f[
1496  * {}_1F_1(a;c;x) = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{(a)_n x^n}{(c)_n n!}
1497  * @f]
1498  * where the Pochhammer symbol is @f$ (x)_k = (x)(x+1)...(x+k-1) @f$,
1499  * @f$ (x)_0 = 1 @f$
1500  *
1501  * @param __a The numerator parameter
1502  * @param __c The denominator parameter
1503  * @param __x The argument
1504  */
1505  template<typename _Tpa, typename _Tpc, typename _Tp>
1506  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpa, _Tpc, _Tp>
1507  conf_hyperg(_Tpa __a, _Tpc __c, _Tp __x)
1508  {
1509  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpa, _Tpc, _Tp>;
1510  return std::__detail::__conf_hyperg<__type>(__a, __c, __x);
1511  }
1512 
1513  // Confluent hypergeometric functions
1514 
1515  /**
1516  * Return the Tricomi confluent hypergeometric function @f$ U(a,c,x) @f$
1517  * of @c float numerator parameter @f$ a @f$, denominator parameter @f$ c @f$,
1518  * and argument @f$ x @f$.
1519  *
1520  * @see tricomi_u for details.
1521  */
1522  inline float
1523  tricomi_uf(float __a, float __c, float __x)
1524  { return std::__detail::__tricomi_u<float>(__a, __c, __x); }
1525 
1526  /**
1527  * Return the Tricomi confluent hypergeometric function @f$ U(a,c,x) @f$
1528  * of <tt>long double</tt> numerator parameter @f$ a @f$,
1529  * denominator parameter @f$ c @f$, and argument @f$ x @f$.
1530  *
1531  * @see tricomi_u for details.
1532  */
1533  inline long double
1534  tricomi_ul(long double __a, long double __c, long double __x)
1535  { return std::__detail::__tricomi_u<long double>(__a, __c, __x); }
1536 
1537  /**
1538  * Return the Tricomi confluent hypergeometric function @f$ U(a,c,x) @f$
1539  * of real numerator parameter @f$ a @f$, denominator parameter @f$ c @f$,
1540  * and argument @f$ x @f$.
1541  *
1542  * The Tricomi confluent hypergeometric function is defined by
1543  * @f[
1544  * U(a,c,x) = \frac{\Gamma(1-c)}{\Gamma(a-c+1)} {}_1F_1(a;c;x)
1545  * + \frac{\Gamma(c-1)}{\Gamma(a)} x^{1-c} {}_1F_1(a-c+1;2-c;x)
1546  * @f]
1547  * where @f$ {}_1F_1(a;c;x) @f$ if the confluent hypergeometric function.
1548  *
1549  * @see conf_hyperg.
1550  *
1551  * @param __a The numerator parameter
1552  * @param __c The denominator parameter
1553  * @param __x The argument
1554  */
1555  template<typename _Tpa, typename _Tpc, typename _Tp>
1556  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpa, _Tpc, _Tp>
1557  tricomi_u(_Tpa __a, _Tpc __c, _Tp __x)
1558  {
1559  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpa, _Tpc, _Tp>;
1560  return std::__detail::__tricomi_u<__type>(__a, __c, __x);
1561  }
1562 
1563  // Hypergeometric functions
1564 
1565  /**
1566  * Return the hypergeometric function @f$ {}_2F_1(a,b;c;x) @f$
1567  * of @c float numerator parameters @f$ a @f$ and @f$ b @f$,
1568  * denominator parameter @f$ c @f$, and argument @f$ x @f$.
1569  *
1570  * @see hyperg for details.
1571  */
1572  inline float
1573  hypergf(float __a, float __b, float __c, float __x)
1574  { return std::__detail::__hyperg<float>(__a, __b, __c, __x); }
1575 
1576  /**
1577  * Return the hypergeometric function @f$ {}_2F_1(a,b;c;x) @f$
1578  * of <tt>long double</tt> numerator parameters @f$ a @f$ and @f$ b @f$,
1579  * denominator parameter @f$ c @f$, and argument @f$ x @f$.
1580  *
1581  * @see hyperg for details.
1582  */
1583  inline long double
1584  hypergl(long double __a, long double __b, long double __c, long double __x)
1585  { return std::__detail::__hyperg<long double>(__a, __b, __c, __x); }
1586 
1587  /**
1588  * Return the hypergeometric function @f$ {}_2F_1(a,b;c;x) @f$
1589  * of real numerator parameters @f$ a @f$ and @f$ b @f$,
1590  * denominator parameter @f$ c @f$, and argument @f$ x @f$.
1591  *
1592  * The hypergeometric function is defined by
1593  * @f[
1594  * {}_2F_1(a,b;c;x) = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{(a)_n (b)_n x^n}{(c)_n n!}
1595  * @f]
1596  * where the Pochhammer symbol is @f$ (x)_k = (x)(x+1)...(x+k-1) @f$,
1597  * @f$ (x)_0 = 1 @f$
1598  *
1599  * @param __a The first numerator parameter
1600  * @param __b The second numerator parameter
1601  * @param __c The denominator parameter
1602  * @param __x The argument
1603  */
1604  template<typename _Tpa, typename _Tpb, typename _Tpc, typename _Tp>
1605  inline typename __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpa, _Tpb, _Tpc, _Tp>
1606  hyperg(_Tpa __a, _Tpb __b, _Tpc __c, _Tp __x)
1607  {
1608  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpa, _Tpb, _Tpc, _Tp>;
1609  return std::__detail::__hyperg<__type>(__a, __b, __c, __x);
1610  }
1611 
1612 #if __cplusplus >= 201103L
1613 
1614  // Confluent hypergeometric limit functions
1615 
1616  /**
1617  * Return the confluent hypergeometric limit function @f$ {}_0F_1(;c;x) @f$
1618  * of @c float numerator parameter @f$ c @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
1619  *
1620  * @see conf_hyperg_lim for details.
1621  */
1622  inline float
1623  conf_hyperg_limf(float __c, float __x)
1624  { return std::__detail::__conf_hyperg_lim<float>(__c, __x); }
1625 
1626  /**
1627  * Return the confluent hypergeometric limit function @f$ {}_0F_1(;c;x) @f$
1628  * of <tt>long double</tt> numerator parameter @f$ c @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
1629  *
1630  * @see conf_hyperg_lim for details.
1631  */
1632  inline long double
1633  conf_hyperg_liml(long double __c, long double __x)
1634  { return std::__detail::__conf_hyperg_lim<long double>(__c, __x); }
1635 
1636  /**
1637  * Return the confluent hypergeometric limit function @f$ {}_0F_1(;c;x) @f$
1638  * of real numerator parameter @f$ c @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
1639  *
1640  * The confluent hypergeometric limit function is defined by
1641  * @f[
1642  * {}_0F_1(;c;x) = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{x^n}{(c)_n n!}
1643  * @f]
1644  * where the Pochhammer symbol is @f$ (x)_k = (x)(x+1)...(x+k-1) @f$,
1645  * @f$ (x)_0 = 1 @f$
1646  *
1647  * @param __c The denominator parameter
1648  * @param __x The argument
1649  */
1650  template<typename _Tpc, typename _Tp>
1651  inline typename __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpc, _Tp>
1652  conf_hyperg_lim(_Tpc __c, _Tp __x)
1653  {
1654  typedef typename __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpc, _Tp> __type;
1655  return std::__detail::__conf_hyperg_lim<__type>(__c, __x);
1656  }
1657 
1658  // Sinus cardinal functions
1659 
1660  /**
1661  * Return the sinus cardinal function @f$ sinc_\pi(x) @f$
1662  * for @c float argument @c __x.
1663  *
1664  * @see sinc_pi for details.
1665  */
1666  inline float
1667  sincf(float __x)
1668  { return std::__detail::__sinc<float>(__x); }
1669 
1670  /**
1671  * Return the sinus cardinal function @f$ sinc_\pi(x) @f$
1672  * for <tt>long double</tt> argument @c __x.
1673  *
1674  * @see sinc_pi for details.
1675  */
1676  inline long double
1677  sincl(long double __x)
1678  { return std::__detail::__sinc<long double>(__x); }
1679 
1680  /**
1681  * Return the sinus cardinal function @f$ sinc_\pi(x) @f$
1682  * for real argument @c __x.
1683  * The sinus cardinal function is defined by:
1684  * @f[
1685  * sinc(x) = \frac{sin(x)}{x}
1686  * @f]
1687  *
1688  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
1689  * @param __x The argument
1690  */
1691  template<typename _Tp>
1692  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1693  sinc(_Tp __x)
1694  {
1695  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1696  return std::__detail::__sinc<__type>(__x);
1697  }
1698 
1699  // Normalized sinus cardinal functions
1700 
1701  /**
1702  * Return the reperiodized sinus cardinal function @f$ sinc(x) @f$
1703  * for @c float argument @c __x.
1704  *
1705  * @see sinc for details.
1706  */
1707  inline float
1708  sinc_pif(float __x)
1709  { return std::__detail::__sinc_pi<float>(__x); }
1710 
1711  /**
1712  * Return the reperiodized sinus cardinal function @f$ sinc(x) @f$
1713  * for <tt>long double</tt> argument @c __x.
1714  *
1715  * @see sinc for details.
1716  */
1717  inline long double
1718  sinc_pil(long double __x)
1719  { return std::__detail::__sinc_pi<long double>(__x); }
1720 
1721  /**
1722  * Return the reperiodized sinus cardinal function @f$ sinc(x) @f$
1723  * for real argument @c __x.
1724  * The normalized sinus cardinal function is defined by:
1725  * @f[
1726  * sinc_\pi(x) = \frac{sin(\pi x)}{\pi x}
1727  * @f]
1728  *
1729  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
1730  * @param __x The argument
1731  */
1732  template<typename _Tp>
1733  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1734  sinc_pi(_Tp __x)
1735  {
1736  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1737  return std::__detail::__sinc_pi<__type>(__x);
1738  }
1739 
1740  // Logarithmic integrals
1741 
1742  /**
1743  * Return the logarithmic integral of argument @f$ x @f$.
1744  *
1745  * @see logint for details.
1746  */
1747  inline float
1748  logintf(float __x)
1749  { return std::__detail::__logint<float>(__x); }
1750 
1751  /**
1752  * Return the logarithmic integral of argument @f$ x @f$.
1753  *
1754  * @see logint for details.
1755  */
1756  inline long double
1757  logintl(long double __x)
1758  { return std::__detail::__logint<long double>(__x); }
1759 
1760  /**
1761  * Return the logarithmic integral of argument @f$ x @f$.
1762  *
1763  * The logarithmic integral is defined by
1764  * @f[
1765  * li(x) = \int_0^x \frac{dt}{ln(t)} = Ei(ln(x))
1766  * @f]
1767  * where @f$ Ei(x) @f$ is the exponential integral (see std::expint).
1768  *
1769  * @param __x The real upper integration limit
1770  */
1771  template<typename _Tp>
1772  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1773  logint(_Tp __x)
1774  {
1775  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1776  return std::__detail::__logint<__type>(__x);
1777  }
1778 
1779  // Sine integrals
1780 
1781  /**
1782  * Return the sine integral @f$ Si(x) @f$ of @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
1783  *
1784  * @see sinint for details.
1785  */
1786  inline float
1787  sinintf(float __x)
1788  { return std::__detail::__sincosint<float>(__x).first; }
1789 
1790  /**
1791  * Return the sine integral @f$ Si(x) @f$ of <tt>long double</tt>
1792  * argument @f$ x @f$.
1793  *
1794  * @see sinint for details.
1795  */
1796  inline long double
1797  sinintl(long double __x)
1798  { return std::__detail::__sincosint<long double>(__x).first; }
1799 
1800  /**
1801  * Return the sine integral @f$ Si(x) @f$ of real argument @f$ x @f$.
1802  *
1803  * The sine integral is defined by
1804  * @f[
1805  * Si(x) = \int_0^x \frac{sin(t)}{t}dt
1806  * @f]
1807  *
1808  * @param __x The real upper integration limit
1809  */
1810  template<typename _Tp>
1811  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1812  sinint(_Tp __x)
1813  {
1814  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1815  return std::__detail::__sincosint<__type>(__x).first;
1816  }
1817 
1818  // Cosine integrals
1819 
1820  /**
1821  * Return the cosine integral @f$ Ci(x) @f$ of @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
1822  *
1823  * @see cosint for details.
1824  */
1825  inline float
1826  cosintf(float __x)
1827  { return std::__detail::__sincosint<float>(__x).second; }
1828 
1829  /**
1830  * Return the cosine integral @f$ Ci(x) @f$ of <tt>long double</tt>
1831  * argument @f$ x @f$.
1832  *
1833  * @see cosint for details.
1834  */
1835  inline long double
1836  cosintl(long double __x)
1837  { return std::__detail::__sincosint<long double>(__x).second; }
1838 
1839  /**
1840  * Return the cosine integral @f$ Ci(x) @f$ of real argument @f$ x @f$.
1841  *
1842  * The cosine integral is defined by
1843  * @f[
1844  * Ci(x) = -\int_x^\infty \frac{cos(t)}{t}dt
1845  * = \gamma_E + ln(x) + \int_0^x \frac{cos(t)-1}{t}dt
1846  * @f]
1847  *
1848  * @param __x The real upper integration limit
1849  */
1850  template<typename _Tp>
1851  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1852  cosint(_Tp __x)
1853  {
1854  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1855  return std::__detail::__sincosint<__type>(__x).second;
1856  }
1857 
1858  // Hyperbolic sine integrals
1859 
1860  /**
1861  * Return the hyperbolic sine integral of @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
1862  *
1863  * @see sinhint for details.
1864  */
1865  inline float
1866  sinhintf(float __x)
1867  { return std::__detail::__sinhint<float>(__x); }
1868 
1869  /**
1870  * Return the hyperbolic sine integral @f$ Shi(x) @f$ of <tt>long double</tt>
1871  * argument @f$ x @f$.
1872  *
1873  * @see sinhint for details.
1874  */
1875  inline long double
1876  sinhintl(long double __x)
1877  { return std::__detail::__sinhint<long double>(__x); }
1878 
1879  /**
1880  * Return the hyperbolic sine integral @f$ Shi(x) @f$
1881  * of real argument @f$ x @f$.
1882  *
1883  * The hyperbolic sine integral is defined by
1884  * @f[
1885  * Shi(x) = \int_0^x \frac{\sinh(t)}{t}dt
1886  * @f]
1887  *
1888  * @tparam _Tp The type of the real argument
1889  * @param __x The argument
1890  */
1891  template<typename _Tp>
1892  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1893  sinhint(_Tp __x)
1894  {
1895  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1896  return std::__detail::__sinhint<__type>(__x);
1897  }
1898 
1899  // Hyperbolic cosine integrals
1900 
1901  /**
1902  * Return the hyperbolic cosine integral of @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
1903  *
1904  * @see coshint for details.
1905  */
1906  inline float
1907  coshintf(float __x)
1908  { return std::__detail::__coshint<float>(__x); }
1909 
1910  /**
1911  * Return the hyperbolic cosine integral @f$ Chi(x) @f$
1912  * of <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
1913  *
1914  * @see coshint for details.
1915  */
1916  inline long double
1917  coshintl(long double __x)
1918  { return std::__detail::__coshint<long double>(__x); }
1919 
1920  /**
1921  * Return the hyperbolic cosine integral @f$ Chi(x) @f$
1922  * of real argument @f$ x @f$.
1923  *
1924  * The hyperbolic cosine integral is defined by
1925  * @f[
1926  * Chi(x) = -\int_x^\infty \frac{\cosh(t)}{t}dt
1927  * = \gamma_E + ln(x) + \int_0^x \frac{\cosh(t)-1}{t}dt
1928  * @f]
1929  *
1930  * @tparam _Tp The type of the real argument
1931  * @param __x The real argument
1932  */
1933  template<typename _Tp>
1934  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
1935  coshint(_Tp __x)
1936  {
1937  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
1938  return std::__detail::__coshint<__type>(__x);
1939  }
1940 
1941  // Jacobi elliptic sine amplitude functions.
1942 
1943  /**
1944  * Return the Jacobi elliptic sine amplitude function @f$ sn(k,u) @f$
1945  * of @c float modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ u @f$.
1946  *
1947  * @see jacobi_sn for details.
1948  */
1949  inline float
1950  jacobi_snf(float __k, float __u)
1951  {
1952  return std::__detail::__jacobi_ellint<float>(__k, __u).__sn_value;
1953  }
1954 
1955  /**
1956  * Return the Jacobi elliptic sine amplitude function @f$ sn(k,u) @f$
1957  * of <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ u @f$.
1958  *
1959  * @see jacobi_sn for details.
1960  */
1961  inline long double
1962  jacobi_snl(long double __k, long double __u)
1963  {
1964  return std::__detail::__jacobi_ellint<long double>(__k, __u).__sn_value;
1965  }
1966 
1967  /**
1968  * Return the Jacobi elliptic sine amplitude function @f$ sn(k,u) @f$
1969  * of real modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ u @f$.
1970  *
1971  * The Jacobi elliptic @c sn integral is defined by
1972  * @f[
1973  * \sin(\phi) = sn(k, F(k,\phi))
1974  * @f]
1975  * where @f$ F(k,\phi) @f$ is the Legendre elliptic integral
1976  * of the first kind (see ellint_1).
1977  *
1978  * @tparam _Kp The type of the real modulus
1979  * @tparam _Up The type of the real argument
1980  * @param __k The real modulus
1981  * @param __u The real argument
1982  */
1983  template<typename _Kp, typename _Up>
1984  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Kp, _Up>
1985  jacobi_sn(_Kp __k, _Up __u)
1986  {
1987  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Kp, _Up>;
1988  return std::__detail::__jacobi_ellint<__type>(__k, __u).__sn_value;
1989  }
1990 
1991  // Jacobi elliptic cosine amplitude functions.
1992 
1993  /**
1994  * Return the Jacobi elliptic cosine amplitude function @f$ cn(k,u) @f$
1995  * of @c float modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ u @f$.
1996  *
1997  * @see jacobi_cn for details.
1998  */
1999  inline float
2000  jacobi_cnf(float __k, float __u)
2001  {
2002  return std::__detail::__jacobi_ellint<float>(__k, __u).__cn_value;
2003  }
2004 
2005  /**
2006  * Return the Jacobi elliptic cosine amplitude function @f$ cn(k,u) @f$
2007  * of <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ u @f$.
2008  *
2009  * @see jacobi_cn for details.
2010  */
2011  inline long double
2012  jacobi_cnl(long double __k, long double __u)
2013  {
2014  return std::__detail::__jacobi_ellint<long double>(__k, __u).__cn_value;
2015  }
2016 
2017  /**
2018  * Return the Jacobi elliptic cosine amplitude function @f$ cn(k,u) @f$
2019  * of real modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ u @f$.
2020  *
2021  * The Jacobi elliptic @c cn integral is defined by
2022  * @f[
2023  * \cos(\phi) = cn(k, F(k,\phi))
2024  * @f]
2025  * where @f$ F(k,\phi) @f$ is the Legendre elliptic integral
2026  * of the first kind (see ellint_1).
2027  *
2028  * @tparam _Kp The type of the real modulus
2029  * @tparam _Up The type of the real argument
2030  * @param __k The real modulus
2031  * @param __u The real argument
2032  */
2033  template<typename _Kp, typename _Up>
2034  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Kp, _Up>
2035  jacobi_cn(_Kp __k, _Up __u)
2036  {
2037  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Kp, _Up>;
2038  return std::__detail::__jacobi_ellint<__type>(__k, __u).__cn_value;
2039  }
2040 
2041  // Jacobi elliptic delta amplitude functions.
2042 
2043  /**
2044  * Return the Jacobi elliptic delta amplitude function @f$ dn(k,u) @f$
2045  * of @c float modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ u @f$.
2046  *
2047  * @see jacobi_dn for details.
2048  */
2049  inline float
2050  jacobi_dnf(float __k, float __u)
2051  {
2052  return std::__detail::__jacobi_ellint<float>(__k, __u).__dn_value;
2053  }
2054 
2055  /**
2056  * Return the Jacobi elliptic delta amplitude function @f$ dn(k,u) @f$
2057  * of <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ u @f$.
2058  *
2059  * @see jacobi_dn for details.
2060  */
2061  inline long double
2062  jacobi_dnl(long double __k, long double __u)
2063  {
2064  return std::__detail::__jacobi_ellint<long double>(__k, __u).__dn_value;
2065  }
2066 
2067  /**
2068  * Return the Jacobi elliptic delta amplitude function @f$ dn(k,u) @f$
2069  * of real modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ u @f$.
2070  *
2071  * The Jacobi elliptic @c dn integral is defined by
2072  * @f[
2073  * \sqrt{1 - k^2\sin(\phi)} = dn(k, F(k,\phi))
2074  * @f]
2075  * where @f$ F(k,\phi) @f$ is the Legendre elliptic integral
2076  * of the first kind (see ellint_1).
2077  *
2078  * @tparam _Kp The type of the real modulus
2079  * @tparam _Up The type of the real argument
2080  * @param __k The real modulus
2081  * @param __u The real argument
2082  */
2083  template<typename _Kp, typename _Up>
2084  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Kp, _Up>
2085  jacobi_dn(_Kp __k, _Up __u)
2086  {
2087  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Kp, _Up>;
2088  return std::__detail::__jacobi_ellint<__type>(__k, __u).__dn_value;
2089  }
2090 
2091  // Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind
2092 
2093  /**
2094  * Return the Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind @f$ T_n(x) @f$
2095  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
2096  *
2097  * @see chebyshev_t for details.
2098  */
2099  inline float
2100  chebyshev_tf(unsigned int __n, float __x)
2101  { return std::__detail::__chebyshev_t<float>(__n, __x).__T_n; }
2102 
2103  /**
2104  * Return the Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind @f$ T_n(x) @f$
2105  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
2106  *
2107  * @see chebyshev_t for details.
2108  */
2109  inline long double
2110  chebyshev_tl(unsigned int __n, long double __x)
2111  { return std::__detail::__chebyshev_t<long double>(__n, __x).__T_n; }
2112 
2113  /**
2114  * Return the Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind @f$ T_n(x) @f$
2115  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
2116  *
2117  * The Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind is defined by:
2118  * @f[
2119  * T_n(x) = \cos(n \theta)
2120  * @f]
2121  * where @f$ \theta = \arccos(x) @f$, @f$ -1 <= x <= +1 @f$.
2122  *
2123  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
2124  * @param __n The non-negative integral order
2125  * @param __x The real argument @f$ -1 <= x <= +1 @f$
2126  */
2127  template<typename _Tp>
2128  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
2129  chebyshev_t(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
2130  {
2131  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
2132  return std::__detail::__chebyshev_t<__type>(__n, __x).__T_n;
2133  }
2134 
2135  // Chebyshev polynomials of the second kind
2136 
2137  /**
2138  * Return the Chebyshev polynomials of the second kind @f$ U_n(x) @f$
2139  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
2140  *
2141  * @see chebyshev_u for details.
2142  */
2143  inline float
2144  chebyshev_uf(unsigned int __n, float __x)
2145  { return std::__detail::__chebyshev_u<float>(__n, __x).__U_n; }
2146 
2147  /**
2148  * Return the Chebyshev polynomials of the second kind @f$ U_n(x) @f$
2149  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
2150  *
2151  * @see chebyshev_u for details.
2152  */
2153  inline long double
2154  chebyshev_ul(unsigned int __n, long double __x)
2155  { return std::__detail::__chebyshev_u<long double>(__n, __x).__U_n; }
2156 
2157  /**
2158  * Return the Chebyshev polynomial of the second kind @f$ U_n(x) @f$
2159  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
2160  *
2161  * The Chebyshev polynomial of the second kind is defined by:
2162  * @f[
2163  * U_n(x) = \frac{\sin \left[(n+1)\theta \right]}{\sin(\theta)}
2164  * @f]
2165  * where @f$ \theta = \arccos(x) @f$, @f$ -1 <= x <= +1 @f$.
2166  *
2167  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
2168  * @param __n The non-negative integral order
2169  * @param __x The real argument @f$ -1 <= x <= +1 @f$
2170  */
2171  template<typename _Tp>
2172  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
2173  chebyshev_u(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
2174  {
2175  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
2176  return std::__detail::__chebyshev_u<__type>(__n, __x).__U_n;
2177  }
2178 
2179  // Chebyshev polynomials of the third kind
2180 
2181  /**
2182  * Return the Chebyshev polynomials of the third kind @f$ V_n(x) @f$
2183  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
2184  *
2185  * @see chebyshev_v for details.
2186  */
2187  inline float
2188  chebyshev_vf(unsigned int __n, float __x)
2189  { return std::__detail::__chebyshev_v<float>(__n, __x).__V_n; }
2190 
2191  /**
2192  * Return the Chebyshev polynomials of the third kind @f$ V_n(x) @f$
2193  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
2194  *
2195  * @see chebyshev_v for details.
2196  */
2197  inline long double
2198  chebyshev_vl(unsigned int __n, long double __x)
2199  { return std::__detail::__chebyshev_v<long double>(__n, __x).__V_n; }
2200 
2201  /**
2202  * Return the Chebyshev polynomial of the third kind @f$ V_n(x) @f$
2203  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
2204  *
2205  * The Chebyshev polynomial of the third kind is defined by:
2206  * @f[
2207  * V_n(x) = \frac{\cos \left[ \left(n+\frac{1}{2}\right)\theta \right]}
2208  * {\cos \left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right)}
2209  * @f]
2210  * where @f$ \theta = \arccos(x) @f$, @f$ -1 <= x <= +1 @f$.
2211  *
2212  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
2213  * @param __n The non-negative integral order
2214  * @param __x The real argument @f$ -1 <= x <= +1 @f$
2215  */
2216  template<typename _Tp>
2217  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
2218  chebyshev_v(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
2219  {
2220  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
2221  return std::__detail::__chebyshev_v<__type>(__n, __x).__V_n;
2222  }
2223 
2224  // Chebyshev polynomials of the fourth kind
2225 
2226  /**
2227  * Return the Chebyshev polynomials of the fourth kind @f$ W_n(x) @f$
2228  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
2229  *
2230  * @see chebyshev_w for details.
2231  */
2232  inline float
2233  chebyshev_wf(unsigned int __n, float __x)
2234  { return std::__detail::__chebyshev_w<float>(__n, __x).__W_n; }
2235 
2236  /**
2237  * Return the Chebyshev polynomials of the fourth kind @f$ W_n(x) @f$
2238  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
2239  *
2240  * @see chebyshev_w for details.
2241  */
2242  inline long double
2243  chebyshev_wl(unsigned int __n, long double __x)
2244  { return std::__detail::__chebyshev_w<long double>(__n, __x).__W_n; }
2245 
2246  /**
2247  * Return the Chebyshev polynomial of the fourth kind @f$ W_n(x) @f$
2248  * of non-negative order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
2249  *
2250  * The Chebyshev polynomial of the fourth kind is defined by:
2251  * @f[
2252  * W_n(x) = \frac{\sin \left[ \left(n+\frac{1}{2}\right)\theta \right]}
2253  * {\sin \left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right)}
2254  * @f]
2255  * where @f$ \theta = \arccos(x) @f$, @f$ -1 <= x <= +1 @f$.
2256  *
2257  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
2258  * @param __n The non-negative integral order
2259  * @param __x The real argument @f$ -1 <= x <= +1 @f$
2260  */
2261  template<typename _Tp>
2262  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
2263  chebyshev_w(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
2264  {
2265  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
