4769  ellint_d(_Tk __k, _Tphi __phi)
4770  {
4771  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tk, _Tphi>;
4772  return std::__detail::__ellint_d<__type>(__k, __phi);
4773  }
4774 
4775  // Bulirsch elliptic integrals of the first kind.
4776 
4777  /**
4778  * Return the Bulirsch elliptic integral @f$ el1(x,k_c) @f$
4779  * of the first kind of @c float tangent limit @f$ x @f$
4780  * and complementary modulus @f$ k_c @f$.
4781  *
4782  * @see ellint_el1 for details.
4783  */
4784  inline float
4785  ellint_el1f(float __x, float __k_c)
4786  { return std::__detail::__ellint_el1<float>(__x, __k_c); }
4787 
4788  /**
4789  * Return the Bulirsch elliptic integral @f$ el1(x,k_c) @f$
4790  * of the first kind of real tangent limit @f$ x @f$
4791  * and complementary modulus @f$ k_c @f$.
4792  *
4793  * @see ellint_el1 for details.
4794  */
4795  inline long double
4796  ellint_el1l(long double __x, long double __k_c)
4797  { return std::__detail::__ellint_el1<long double>(__x, __k_c); }
4798 
4799  /**
4800  * Return the Bulirsch elliptic integral @f$ el1(x,k_c) @f$
4801  * of the first kind of real tangent limit @f$ x @f$
4802  * and complementary modulus @f$ k_c @f$.
4803  *
4804  * The Bulirsch elliptic integral of the first kind is defined by
4805  * @f[
4806  * el1(x,k_c) = el2(x,k_c,1,1) = \int_0^{\arctan x} \frac{1+1\tan^2\theta}
4807  * {\sqrt{(1+\tan^2\theta)(1+k_c^2\tan^2\theta)}}d\theta
4808  * @f]
4809  *
4810  * @param __x The tangent of the angular integration limit
4811  * @param __k_c The complementary modulus @f$ k_c = \sqrt{1 - k^2} @f$
4812  */
4813  template<typename _Tp, typename _Tk>
4814  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tk>
4815  ellint_el1(_Tp __x, _Tk __k_c)
4816  {
4817  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tk>;
4818  return std::__detail::__ellint_el1<__type>(__x, __k_c);
4819  }
4820 
4821  // Bulirsch elliptic integrals of the second kind.
4822 
4823  /**
4824  * Return the Bulirsch elliptic integral of the second kind
4825  * @f$ el2(x,k_c,a,b) @f$.
4826  *
4827  * @see ellint_el2 for details.
4828  */
4829  inline float
4830  ellint_el2f(float __x, float __k_c, float __a, float __b)
4831  { return std::__detail::__ellint_el2<float>(__x, __k_c, __a, __b); }
4832 
4833  /**
4834  * Return the Bulirsch elliptic integral of the second kind
4835  * @f$ el2(x,k_c,a,b) @f$.
4836  *
4837  * @see ellint_el2 for details.
4838  */
4839  inline long double
4840  ellint_el2l(long double __x, long double __k_c,
4841  long double __a, long double __b)
4842  { return std::__detail::__ellint_el2<long double>(__x, __k_c, __a, __b); }
4843 
4844  /**
4845  * Return the Bulirsch elliptic integral of the second kind
4846  * @f$ el2(x,k_c,a,b) @f$.
4847  *
4848  * The Bulirsch elliptic integral of the second kind is defined by
4849  * @f[
4850  * el2(x,k_c,a,b) = \int_0^{\arctan x} \frac{a+b\tan^2\theta}
4851  * {\sqrt{(1+\tan^2\theta)(1+k_c^2\tan^2\theta)}}d\theta
4852  * @f]
4853  *
4854  * @param __x The tangent of the angular integration limit
4855  * @param __k_c The complementary modulus @f$ k_c = \sqrt{1 - k^2} @f$
4856  * @param __a The parameter
4857  * @param __b The parameter
4858  */
4859  template<typename _Tp, typename _Tk, typename _Ta, typename _Tb>
4860  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tk, _Ta, _Tb>
4861  ellint_el2(_Tp __x, _Tk __k_c, _Ta __a, _Tb __b)
4862  {
4863  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Tk, _Ta, _Tb>;
4864  return std::__detail::__ellint_el2<__type>(__x, __k_c, __a, __b);
4865  }
4866 
4867  // Bulirsch elliptic integrals of the third kind.
4868 
4869  /**
4870  * Return the Bulirsch elliptic integral of the third kind
4871  * @f$ el3(x,k_c,p) @f$ of @c float tangent limit @f$ x @f$,
4872  * complementary modulus @f$ k_c @f$, and parameter @f$ p @f$.
4873  *
4874  * @see ellint_el3 for details.
4875  */
4876  inline float
4877  ellint_el3f(float __x, float __k_c, float __p)
4878  { return std::__detail::__ellint_el3<float>(__x, __k_c, __p); }
4879 
4880  /**
4881  * Return the Bulirsch elliptic integral of the third kind
4882  * @f$ el3(x,k_c,p) @f$ of <tt>long double</tt> tangent limit @f$ x @f$,
4883  * complementary modulus @f$ k_c @f$, and parameter @f$ p @f$.
4884  *
4885  * @see ellint_el3 for details.
4886  */
4887  inline long double
4888  ellint_el3l(long double __x, long double __k_c, long double __p)
4889  { return std::__detail::__ellint_el3<long double>(__x, __k_c, __p); }
4890 
4891  /**
4892  * Return the Bulirsch elliptic integral of the third kind
4893  * @f$ el3(x,k_c,p) @f$ of real tangent limit @f$ x @f$,
4894  * complementary modulus @f$ k_c @f$, and parameter @f$ p @f$.
4895  *
4896  * The Bulirsch elliptic integral of the third kind is defined by
4897  * @f[
4898  * el3(x,k_c,p) = \int_0^{\arctan x} \frac{d\theta}
4899  * {(cos^2\theta+p\sin^2\theta)\sqrt{cos^2\theta+k_c^2\sin^2\theta}}
4900  * @f]
4901  *
4902  * @param __x The tangent of the angular integration limit
4903  * @param __k_c The complementary modulus @f$ k_c = \sqrt{1 - k^2} @f$
4904  * @param __p The paramenter
4905  */
4906  template<typename _Tx, typename _Tk, typename _Tp>
4907  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tx, _Tk, _Tp>
4908  ellint_el3(_Tx __x, _Tk __k_c, _Tp __p)
4909  {
4910  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tx, _Tk, _Tp>;
4911  return std::__detail::__ellint_el3<__type>(__x, __k_c, __p);
4912  }
4913 
4914  // Bulirsch complete elliptic integrals.
4915 
4916  /**
4917  * Return the Bulirsch complete elliptic integral @f$ cel(k_c,p,a,b) @f$
4918  * of real complementary modulus @f$ k_c @f$, and parameters @f$ p @f$,
4919  * @f$ a @f$, and @f$ b @f$.
4920  *
4921  * @see ellint_cel for details.
4922  */
4923  inline float
4924  ellint_celf(float __k_c, float __p, float __a, float __b)
4925  { return std::__detail::__ellint_cel<float>(__k_c, __p, __a, __b); }
4926 
4927  /**
4928  * Return the Bulirsch complete elliptic integral @f$ cel(k_c,p,a,b) @f$.
4929  *
4930  * @see ellint_cel for details.
4931  */
4932  inline long double
4933  ellint_cell(long double __k_c, long double __p,
4934  long double __a, long double __b)
4935  { return std::__detail::__ellint_cel<long double>(__k_c, __p, __a, __b); }
4936 
4937  /**
4938  * Return the Bulirsch complete elliptic integral @f$ cel(k_c,p,a,b) @f$
4939  * of real complementary modulus @f$ k_c @f$, and parameters @f$ p @f$,
4940  * @f$ a @f$, and @f$ b @f$.
4941  *
4942  * The Bulirsch complete elliptic integral is defined by
4943  * @f[
4944  * cel(k_c,p,a,b)=\int_0^{\pi/2}
4945  * \frac{a\cos^2\theta + b\sin^2\theta}{cos^2\theta + p\sin^2\theta}
4946  * \frac{d\theta}{\sqrt{cos^2\theta + k_c^2\sin^2\theta}}
4947  * @f]
4948  *
4949  * @param __k_c The complementary modulus @f$ k_c = \sqrt{1 - k^2} @f$
4950  * @param __p The parameter
4951  * @param __a The parameter
4952  * @param __b The parameter
4953  */
4954  template<typename _Tk, typename _Tp, typename _Ta, typename _Tb>
4955  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tk, _Tp, _Ta, _Tb>
4956  ellint_cel(_Tk __k_c, _Tp __p, _Ta __a, _Tb __b)
4957  {
4958  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tk, _Tp, _Ta, _Tb>;
4959  return std::__detail::__ellint_cel<__type>(__k_c, __p, __a, __b);
4960  }
4961 
4962  // Cylindrical Hankel functions of the first kind.
4963 
4964  /**
4965  * Return the complex cylindrical Hankel function of the first kind
4966  * @f$ H^{(1)}_\nu(x) @f$ of <tt>std::complex<float></tt> order @f$ \nu @f$
4967  * and argument @f$ x @f$.
4968  *
4969  * @see cyl_hankel_1 for more details.
4970  */
4971  inline std::complex<float>
4972  cyl_hankel_1f(std::complex<float> __nu, std::complex<float> __x)
4973  { return std::__detail::__cyl_hankel_1<float>(__nu, __x); }
4974 
4975  /**
4976  * Return the complex cylindrical Hankel function of the first kind
4977  * @f$ H^{(1)}_\nu(x) @f$ of <tt>std::complex<long double></tt>
4978  * order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
4979  *
4980  * @see cyl_hankel_1 for more details.
4981  */
4982  inline std::complex<long double>
4983  cyl_hankel_1l(std::complex<long double> __nu, std::complex<long double> __x)
4984  { return std::__detail::__cyl_hankel_1<long double>(__nu, __x); }
4985 
4986  /**
4987  * Return the complex cylindrical Hankel function of the first kind
4988  * @f$ H^{(1)}_\nu(x) @f$ of complex order @f$ \nu @f$
4989  * and argument @f$ x @f$.
4990  *
4991  * The cylindrical Hankel function of the first kind is defined by
4992  * @f[
4993  * H^{(1)}_\nu(x) = J_\nu(x) + i N_\nu(x)
4994  * @f]
4995  *
4996  * @tparam _Tpnu The complex type of the order
4997  * @tparam _Tp The complex type of the argument
4998  * @param __nu The complex order
4999  * @param __x The complex argument
5000  */
5001  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
5002  inline std::complex<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>>
5003  cyl_hankel_1(std::complex<_Tpnu> __nu, std::complex<_Tp> __x)
5004  {
5005  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
5006  return std::__detail::__cyl_hankel_1<__type>(__nu, __x);
5007  }
5008 
5009  // Cylindrical Hankel functions of the second kind.
5010 
5011  /**
5012  * Return the complex cylindrical Hankel function of the second kind
5013  * @f$ H^{(2)}_\nu(x) @f$ of <tt>std::complex<float></tt> order @f$ \nu @f$
5014  * and argument @f$ x @f$.
5015  *
5016  * @see cyl_hankel_2 for more details.
5017  */
5018  inline std::complex<float>
5019  cyl_hankel_2f(std::complex<float> __nu, std::complex<float> __x)
5020  { return std::__detail::__cyl_hankel_2<float>(__nu, __x); }
5021 
5022  /**
5023  * Return the complex cylindrical Hankel function of the second kind
5024  * @f$ H^{(2)}_\nu(x) @f$ of <tt>std::complex<long double></tt>
5025  * order @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5026  *
5027  * @see cyl_hankel_2 for more details.
5028  */
5029  inline std::complex<long double>
5030  cyl_hankel_2l(std::complex<long double> __nu, std::complex<long double> __x)
5031  { return std::__detail::__cyl_hankel_2<long double>(__nu, __x); }
5032 
5033  /**
5034  * Return the complex cylindrical Hankel function of the second kind
5035  * @f$ H^{(2)}_\nu(x) @f$ of complex order @f$ \nu @f$
5036  * and argument @f$ x @f$.
5037  *
5038  * The cylindrical Hankel function of the second kind is defined by
5039  * @f[
5040  * H^{(2)}_\nu(x) = J_\nu(x) - i N_\nu(x)
5041  * @f]
5042  *
5043  * @tparam _Tpnu The complex type of the order
5044  * @tparam _Tp The complex type of the argument
5045  * @param __nu The complex order
5046  * @param __x The complex argument
5047  */
5048  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
5049  inline std::complex<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>>
5050  cyl_hankel_2(std::complex<_Tpnu> __nu, std::complex<_Tp> __x)
5051  {
5052  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
5053  return std::__detail::__cyl_hankel_2<__type>(__nu, __x);
5054  }
5055 
5056  // Spherical Hankel functions of the first kind.
5057 
5058  /**
5059  * Return the complex spherical Hankel function of the first kind
5060  * @f$ h^{(1)}_n(x) @f$ of non-negative integral @f$ n @f$
5061  * and <tt>std::complex<float></tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
5062  *
5063  * @see sph_hankel_1 for more details.
5064  */
5065  inline std::complex<float>
5066  sph_hankel_1f(unsigned int __n, std::complex<float> __x)
5067  { return std::__detail::__sph_hankel_1<float>(__n, __x); }
5068 
5069  /**
5070  * Return the complex spherical Hankel function of the first kind
5071  * @f$ h^{(1)}_n(x) @f$ of non-negative integral @f$ n @f$
5072  * and <tt>std::complex<long double></tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
5073  *
5074  * @see sph_hankel_1 for more details.
5075  */
5076  inline std::complex<long double>
5077  sph_hankel_1l(unsigned int __n, std::complex<long double> __x)
5078  { return std::__detail::__sph_hankel_1<long double>(__n, __x); }
5079 
5080  /**
5081  * Return the complex spherical Hankel function of the first kind
5082  * @f$ h^{(1)}_n(x) @f$ of non-negative integral @f$ n @f$
5083  * and complex argument @f$ x @f$.
5084  *
5085  * The spherical Hankel function of the first kind is defined by
5086  * @f[
5087  * h^{(1)}_n(x) = \left(\frac{\pi}{2x} \right) ^{1/2} H^{(1)}_{n+1/2}(x)
5088  * = j_n(x) + i n_n(x)
5089  * @f]
5090  * where @f$ j_n(x) @f$ and @f$ n_n(x) @f$ are the spherical Bessel
5091  * and Neumann functions respectively.
5092  *
5093  * @param __n The integral order >= 0
5094  * @param __x The complex argument
5095  */
5096  template<typename _Tp>
5097  inline std::complex<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>>
5098  sph_hankel_1(unsigned int __n, std::complex<_Tp> __x)
5099  {
5100  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5101  return std::__detail::__sph_hankel_1<__type>(__n, __x);
5102  }
5103 
5104  // Spherical Hankel functions of the second kind.
5105 
5106  /**
5107  * Return the complex spherical Hankel function of the second kind
5108  * @f$ h^{(2)}_n(x) @f$ of non-negative integral @f$ n @f$
5109  * and <tt>std::complex<float></tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
5110  *
5111  * @see sph_hankel_2 for more details.
5112  */
5113  inline std::complex<float>
5114  sph_hankel_2f(unsigned int __n, std::complex<float> __x)
5115  { return std::__detail::__sph_hankel_2<float>(__n, __x); }
5116 
5117  /**
5118  * Return the complex spherical Hankel function of the second kind
5119  * @f$ h^{(2)}_n(x) @f$ of non-negative integral @f$ n @f$
5120  * and <tt>std::complex<long double></tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
5121  *
5122  * @see sph_hankel_2 for more details.
5123  */
5124  inline std::complex<long double>
5125  sph_hankel_2l(unsigned int __n, std::complex<long double> __x)
5126  { return std::__detail::__sph_hankel_2<long double>(__n, __x); }
5127 
5128  /**
5129  * Return the complex spherical Hankel function of the second kind
5130  * @f$ h^{(2)}_n(x) @f$ of nonnegative order @f$ n @f$
5131  * and complex argument @f$ x @f$.
5132  *
5133  * The spherical Hankel function of the second kind is defined by
5134  * @f[
5135  * h^{(2)}_n(x) = \left(\frac{\pi}{2x} \right) ^{1/2} H^{(2)}_{n+1/2}(x)
5136  * = j_n(x) - i n_n(x)
5137  * @f]
5138  * where @f$ j_n(x) @f$ and @f$ n_n(x) @f$ are the spherical Bessel
5139  * and Neumann functions respectively.
5140  *
5141  * @param __n The integral order >= 0
5142  * @param __x The complex argument
5143  */
5144  template<typename _Tp>
5145  inline std::complex<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>>
5146  sph_hankel_2(unsigned int __n, std::complex<_Tp> __x)
5147  {
5148  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5149  return std::__detail::__sph_hankel_2<__type>(__n, __x);
5150  }
5151 
5152  // Spherical harmonic functions
5153 
5154  /**
5155  * Return the complex spherical harmonic function of degree @f$ l @f$,
5156  * order @f$ m @f$, and @c float zenith angle @f$ \theta @f$,
5157  * and azimuth angle @f$ \phi @f$.
5158  *
5159  * @see sph_harmonic for details.
5160  */
5161  inline std::complex<float>
5162  sph_harmonicf(unsigned int __l, int __m,
5163  float __theta, float __phi)
5164  { return std::__detail::__sph_harmonic<float>(__l, __m, __theta, __phi); }
5165 
5166  /**
5167  * Return the complex spherical harmonic function of degree @f$ l @f$,
5168  * order @f$ m @f$, and <tt>long double</tt> zenith angle @f$ \theta @f$,
5169  * and azimuth angle @f$ \phi @f$.
5170  *
5171  * @see sph_harmonic for details.
5172  */
5173  inline std::complex<long double>
5174  sph_harmonicl(unsigned int __l, int __m,
5175  long double __theta, long double __phi)
5176  {
5177  return std::__detail::__sph_harmonic<long double>(__l, __m, __theta, __phi);
5178  }
5179 
5180  /**
5181  * Return the complex spherical harmonic function of degree @f$ l @f$,
5182  * order @f$ m @f$, and real zenith angle @f$ \theta @f$,
5183  * and azimuth angle @f$ \phi @f$.
5184  *
5185  * The spherical harmonic function is defined by:
5186  * @f[
5187  * Y_l^m(\theta,\phi) = (-1)^m\frac{(2l+1)}{4\pi} \frac{(l-m)!}{(l+m)!}
5188  * P_l^{|m|}(\cos\theta) \exp^{im\phi}
5189  * @f]
5190  * @note @f$ Y_l^m(\theta,\phi) = 0 @f$ if @f$ |m| > l @f$.
5191  *
5192  * @param __l The order
5193  * @param __m The degree
5194  * @param __theta The zenith angle in radians
5195  * @param __phi The azimuth angle in radians
5196  */
5197  template<typename _Ttheta, typename _Tphi>
5198  inline std::complex<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ttheta, _Tphi>>
5199  sph_harmonic(unsigned int __l, int __m, _Ttheta __theta, _Tphi __phi)
5200  {
5201  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ttheta, _Tphi>;
5202  return std::__detail::__sph_harmonic<__type>(__l, __m, __theta, __phi);
5203  }
5204 
5205  // Polylogarithm functions
5206 
5207  /**
5208  * Return the real polylogarithm function of real order @f$ s @f$
5209  * and real argument @f$ w @f$.
5210  *
5211  * @see polylog for details.
5212  */
5213  inline float
5214  polylogf(float __s, float __w)
5215  { return std::__detail::__polylog<float>(__s, __w); }
5216 
5217  /**
5218  * Return the complex polylogarithm function of real order @f$ s @f$
5219  * and argument @f$ w @f$.
5220  *
5221  * @see polylog for details.
5222  */
5223  inline long double
5224  polylogl(long double __s, long double __w)
5225  { return std::__detail::__polylog<long double>(__s, __w); }
5226 
5227  /**
5228  * Return the polylogarithm function of real order @f$ s @f$
5229  * and real argument @f$ w @f$.
5230  *
5231  * The polylogarithm function is defined by
5232  * @f[
5233  * Li_s(w) = \sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{w^k}{k^s}
5234  * @f]
5235  *
5236  * @param __s Order.
5237  * @param __w Argument.
5238  */
5239  template<typename _Tp, typename _Wp>
5240  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Wp>
5241  polylog(_Tp __s, _Wp __w)
5242  {
5243  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Wp>;
5244  return std::__detail::__polylog<__type>(__s, __w);
5245  }
5246 
5247  /**
5248  * Return the complex polylogarithm function of real order @f$ s @f$
5249  * and complex argument @f$ w @f$.
5250  *
5251  * @see polylog for details.
5252  */
5253  inline std::complex<float>
5254  polylogf(float __s, std::complex<float> __w)
5255  { return std::__detail::__polylog<float>(__s, __w); }
5256 
5257  /**
5258  * Return the complex polylogarithm function of real order @f$ s @f$
5259  * and complex argument @f$ w @f$.
5260  *
5261  * @see polylog for details.
5262  */
5263  inline std::complex<long double>
5264  polylogl(long double __s, std::complex<long double> __w)
5265  { return std::__detail::__polylog<long double>(__s, __w); }
5266 
5267  /**
5268  * Return the complex polylogarithm function of real order @f$ s @f$
5269  * and complex argument @f$ w @f$.
5270  *
5271  * The polylogarithm function is defined by
5272  * @f[
5273  * Li_s(w) = \sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{w^k}{k^s}
5274  * @f]
5275  *
5276  * @param __s Order.
5277  * @param __w Argument.
5278  */
5279  template<typename _Tp, typename _Wp>
5280  inline std::complex<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Wp>>
5281  polylog(_Tp __s, std::complex<_Tp> __w)
5282  {
5283  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Wp>;
5284  return std::__detail::__polylog<__type>(__s, __w);
5285  }
5286 
5287  // Dirichlet eta function
5288 
5289  /**
5290  * Return the Dirichlet eta function of real argument @f$ s @f$.
5291  *
5292  * @see dirichlet_eta for details.
5293  */
5294  inline float
5295  dirichlet_etaf(float __s)
5296  { return std::__detail::__dirichlet_eta<float>(__s); }
5297 
5298  /**
5299  * Return the Dirichlet eta function of real argument @f$ s @f$.
5300  *
5301  * @see dirichlet_eta for details.
5302  */
5303  inline long double
5304  dirichlet_etal(long double __s)
5305  { return std::__detail::__dirichlet_eta<long double>(__s); }
5306 
5307  /**
5308  * Return the Dirichlet eta function of real argument @f$ s @f$.
5309  *
5310  * The Dirichlet eta function is defined by
5311  * @f[
5312  * \eta(s) = \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{(-1)^k}{k^s}
5313  * = \left( 1 - 2^{1-s} \right) \zeta(s)
5314  * @f]
5315  * An important reflection formula is:
5316  * @f[
5317  * \eta(-s) = 2 \frac{1-2^{-s-1}}{1-2^{-s}} \pi^{-s-1}
5318  * s \sin(\frac{\pi s}{2}) \Gamma(s) \eta(s+1)
5319  * @f]
5320  * The Dirichlet eta function, in terms of the polylogarithm, is
5321  * @f[
5322  * \eta(s) = -\Re[Li_s(-1)]
5323  * @f]
5324  *
5325  * @param __s The order.
5326  */
5327  template<typename _Tp>
5328  inline _Tp
5329  dirichlet_eta(_Tp __s)
5330  {
5331  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5332  return std::__detail::__dirichlet_eta<__type>(__s);
5333  }
5334 
5335  // Dirichlet beta function
5336 
5337  /**
5338  * Return the Dirichlet beta function of real argument @f$ s @f$.
5339  *
5340  * @see dirichlet_beta for details.
5341  */
5342  inline float
5343  dirichlet_betaf(float __s)
5344  { return std::__detail::__dirichlet_beta<float>(__s); }
5345 
5346  /**
5347  * Return the Dirichlet beta function of real argument @f$ s @f$.
5348  *
5349  * @see dirichlet_beta for details.
5350  */
5351  inline long double
5352  dirichlet_betal(long double __s)
5353  { return std::__detail::__dirichlet_beta<long double>(__s); }
5354 
5355  /**
5356  * Return the Dirichlet beta function of real argument @f$ s @f$.
5357  *
5358  * The Dirichlet beta function is defined by:
5359  * @f[
5360  * \beta(s) = \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{(-1)^k}{(2k+1)^s}
5361  * @f]
5362  * An important reflection formula is:
5363  * @f[
5364  * \beta(1-s) = \left( \frac{2}{\pi}\right)^s \sin(\frac{\pi s}{2})
5365  * \Gamma(s) \beta(s)
5366  * @f]
5367  * The Dirichlet beta function, in terms of the polylogarithm, is
5368  * @f[
5369  * \beta(s) = \Im[Li_s(i)]
5370  * @f]
5371  *
5372  * @param __s The order.
5373  */
5374  template<typename _Tp>
5375  inline _Tp
5376  dirichlet_beta(_Tp __s)
5377  {
5378  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5379  return std::__detail::__dirichlet_beta<__type>(__s);
5380  }
5381 
5382  // Dirichlet lambda function
5383 
5384  /**
5385  * Return the Dirichlet lambda function of real argument @f$ s @f$.
5386  *
5387  * @see dirichlet_lambda for details.
5388  */
5389  inline float
5390  dirichlet_lambdaf(float __s)
5391  { return std::__detail::__dirichlet_lambda<float>(__s); }
5392 
5393  /**
5394  * Return the Dirichlet lambda function of real argument @f$ s @f$.
5395  *
5396  * @see dirichlet_lambda for details.
5397  */
5398  inline long double
5399  dirichlet_lambdal(long double __s)
5400  { return std::__detail::__dirichlet_lambda<long double>(__s); }
5401 
5402  /**
5403  * Return the Dirichlet lambda function of real argument @f$ s @f$.
5404  *
5405  * The Dirichlet lambda function is defined by
5406  * @f[
5407  * \lambda(s) = \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{1}{(2k+1)^s}
5408  * = \left( 1 - 2^{-s} \right) \zeta(s)
5409  * @f]
5410  * In terms of the Riemann zeta and the Dirichlet eta functions
5411  * @f[
5412  * \lambda(s) = \frac{1}{2}(\zeta(s) + \eta(s))
5413  * @f]
5414  *
5415  * @param __s The order.
5416  */
5417  template<typename _Tp>
5418  inline _Tp
5419  dirichlet_lambda(_Tp __s)
5420  {
5421  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5422  return std::__detail::__dirichlet_lambda<__type>(__s);
5423  }
5424 
5425  // Clausen Sl functions
5426 
5427  /**
5428  * Return the Clausen sine function @f$ Sl_m(x) @f$ of order @f$ m @f$
5429  * and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
5430  *
5431  * @see clausen_sl for details.
5432  */
5433  inline float
5434  clausen_slf(unsigned int __m, float __x)
5435  { return std::__detail::__clausen_sl<float>(__m, __x); }
5436 
5437  /**
5438  * Return the Clausen sine function @f$ Sl_m(x) @f$ of order @f$ m @f$
5439  * and <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
5440  *
5441  * @see clausen_sl for details.
5442  */
5443  inline long double
5444  clausen_sll(unsigned int __m, long double __x)
5445  { return std::__detail::__clausen_sl<long double>(__m, __x); }
5446 
5447  /**
5448  * Return the Clausen sine function @f$ Sl_m(x) @f$ of order @f$ m @f$
5449  * and real argument @f$ x @f$.
5450  *
5451  * The Clausen sine function is defined by
5452  * @f[
5453  * Sl_m(x) = \sum_{k=1}^\infty\frac{\sin(kx)}{k^m}
5454  * @f]
5455  *
5456  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
5457  * @param __m The unsigned integer order
5458  * @param __x The real argument
5459  */
5460  template<typename _Tp>
5461  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
5462  clausen_sl(unsigned int __m, _Tp __x)
5463  {
5464  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5465  return std::__detail::__clausen_sl<__type>(__m, __x);
5466  }
5467 
5468  // Clausen Cl functions
5469 
5470  /**
5471  * Return the Clausen cosine function @f$ Cl_m(x) @f$ of order @f$ m @f$
5472  * and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
5473  *
5474  * @see clausen_cl for details.
5475  */
5476  inline float
5477  clausen_clf(unsigned int __m, float __x)
5478  { return std::__detail::__clausen_cl<float>(__m, __x); }
5479 
5480  /**
5481  * Return the Clausen cosine function @f$ Cl_m(x) @f$ of order @f$ m @f$
5482  * and <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
5483  *
5484  * @see clausen_cl for details.
5485  */
5486  inline long double
5487  clausen_cll(unsigned int __m, long double __x)
5488  { return std::__detail::__clausen_cl<long double>(__m, __x); }
5489 
5490  /**
5491  * Return the Clausen cosine function @f$ Cl_m(x) @f$ of order @f$ m @f$
5492  * and real argument @f$ x @f$.
5493  *
5494  * The Clausen cosine function is defined by
5495  * @f[
5496  * Cl_m(x) = \sum_{k=1}^\infty\frac{\cos(kx)}{k^m}
5497  * @f]
5498  *
5499  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
5500  * @param __m The unsigned integer order
5501  * @param __x The real argument
5502  */
5503  template<typename _Tp>
5504  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
5505  clausen_cl(unsigned int __m, _Tp __x)
5506  {
5507  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5508  return std::__detail::__clausen_cl<__type>(__m, __x);
5509  }
5510 
5511  // Clausen functions - real argument
5512 
5513  /**
5514  * Return the Clausen function @f$ C_m(x) @f$ of integer order @f$ m @f$
5515  * and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
5516  *
5517  * @see clausen for details.
5518  */
5519  inline float
5520  clausenf(unsigned int __m, float __x)
5521  { return std::__detail::__clausen<float>(__m, __x); }
5522 
5523  /**
5524  * Return the Clausen function @f$ C_m(x) @f$ of integer order @f$ m @f$
5525  * and <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
5526  *
5527  * @see clausen for details.
5528  */
5529  inline long double
5530  clausenl(unsigned int __m, long double __x)
5531  { return std::__detail::__clausen<long double>(__m, __x); }
5532 
5533  /**
5534  * Return the Clausen function @f$ C_m(x) @f$ of integer order @f$ m @f$
5535  * and real argument @f$ x @f$.
5536  *
5537  * The Clausen function is defined by
5538  * @f[
5539  * C_m(x)
5540  * = Sl_m(x) = \sum_{k=1}^\infty\frac{\sin(kx)}{k^m} \mbox{ for even } m
5541  * = Cl_m(x) = \sum_{k=1}^\infty\frac{\cos(kx)}{k^m} \mbox{ for odd } m
5542  * @f]
5543  *
5544  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
5545  * @param __m The integral order
5546  * @param __x The real argument
5547  */
5548  template<typename _Tp>
5549  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
5550  clausen(unsigned int __m, _Tp __x)
5551  {
5552  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5553  return std::__detail::__clausen<__type>(__m, __x);
5554  }
5555 
5556  // Clausen functions - complex argument
5557 
5558  /**
5559  * Return the Clausen function @f$ C_m(z) @f$ of integer order @f$ m @f$
5560  * and <tt>std::complex<float></tt> argument @f$ z @f$.
5561  *
5562  * @see clausen for details.
5563  */
5564  inline std::complex<float>
5565  clausenf(unsigned int __m, std::complex<float> __z)
5566  { return std::__detail::__clausen<float>(__m, __z); }
5567 
5568  /**
5569  * Return the Clausen function @f$ C_m(z) @f$ of integer order @f$ m @f$
5570  * and <tt>std::complex<long double></tt> argument @f$ z @f$.
5571  *
5572  * @see clausen for details.
5573  */
5574  inline std::complex<long double>
5575  clausenl(unsigned int __m, std::complex<long double> __z)
5576  { return std::__detail::__clausen<long double>(__m, __z); }
5577 
5578  /**
5579  * Return the Clausen function @f$ C_m(z) @f$ of integer order @f$ m @f$
5580  * and complex argument @f$ z @f$.
5581  *
5582  * The Clausen function is defined by
5583  * @f[
5584  * C_m(z) = Sl_m(z) = \sum_{k=1}^\infty\frac{\sin(kz)}{k^m} \mbox{ for even } m
5585  * = Cl_m(z) = \sum_{k=1}^\infty\frac{\cos(kz)}{k^m} \mbox{ for odd } m
5586  * @f]
5587  *
5588  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the complex components
5589  * @param __m The integral order
5590  * @param __z The complex argument
5591  */
5592  template<typename _Tp>
5593  inline std::complex<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>>
5594  clausen(unsigned int __m, std::complex<_Tp> __z)
5595  {
5596  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5597  return std::__detail::__clausen<__type>(__m, __z);
5598  }
5599 
5600  // Exponential theta_1 functions.
5601 
5602  /**
5603  * Return the exponential theta-1 function @f$ \theta_1(\nu,x) @f$
5604  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5605  *
5606  * @see theta_1 for details.
5607  */
5608  inline float
5609  theta_1f(float __nu, float __x)
5610  { return std::__detail::__theta_1<float>(__nu, __x); }
5611 
5612  /**
5613  * Return the exponential theta-1 function @f$ \theta_1(\nu,x) @f$
5614  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5615  *
5616  * @see theta_1 for details.
5617  */
5618  inline long double
5619  theta_1l(long double __nu, long double __x)
5620  { return std::__detail::__theta_1<long double>(__nu, __x); }
5621 
5622  /**
5623  * Return the exponential theta-1 function @f$ \theta_1(\nu,x) @f$
5624  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5625  *
5626  * The exponential theta-1 function is defined by
5627  * @f[
5628  * \theta_1(\nu,x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi x}} \sum_{j=-\infty}^{+\infty}
5629  * (-1)^j \exp\left( \frac{-(\nu + j - 1/2)^2}{x} \right)
5630  * @f]
5631  *
5632  * @param __nu The periodic (period = 2) argument
5633  * @param __x The argument
5634  */
5635  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
5636  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>
5637  theta_1(_Tpnu __nu, _Tp __x)
5638  {
5639  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
5640  return std::__detail::__theta_1<__type>(__nu, __x);
5641  }
5642 
5643  // Exponential theta_2 functions.
5644 
5645  /**
5646  * Return the exponential theta-2 function @f$ \theta_2(\nu,x) @f$
5647  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5648  *
5649  * @see theta_2 for details.
5650  */
5651  inline float
5652  theta_2f(float __nu, float __x)
5653  { return std::__detail::__theta_2<float>(__nu, __x); }
5654 
5655  /**
5656  * Return the exponential theta-2 function @f$ \theta_2(\nu,x) @f$
5657  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5658  *
5659  * @see theta_2 for details.
5660  */
5661  inline long double
5662  theta_2l(long double __nu, long double __x)
5663  { return std::__detail::__theta_2<long double>(__nu, __x); }
5664 
5665  /**
5666  * Return the exponential theta-2 function @f$ \theta_2(\nu,x) @f$
5667  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5668  *
5669  * The exponential theta-2 function is defined by
5670  * @f[
5671  * \theta_2(\nu,x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi x}} \sum_{j=-\infty}^{+\infty}
5672  * (-1)^j \exp\left( \frac{-(\nu + j)^2}{x} \right)
5673  * @f]
5674  *
5675  * @param __nu The periodic (period = 2) argument
5676  * @param __x The argument
5677  */
5678  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
5679  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>
5680  theta_2(_Tpnu __nu, _Tp __x)
5681  {
5682  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
5683  return std::__detail::__theta_2<__type>(__nu, __x);
5684  }
5685 
5686  // Exponential theta_3 functions.
5687 
5688  /**
5689  * Return the exponential theta-3 function @f$ \theta_3(\nu,x) @f$
5690  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5691  *
5692  * @see theta_3 for details.
5693  */
5694  inline float
5695  theta_3f(float __nu, float __x)
5696  { return std::__detail::__theta_3<float>(__nu, __x); }
5697 
5698  /**
5699  * Return the exponential theta-3 function @f$ \theta_3(\nu,x) @f$
5700  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5701  *
5702  * @see theta_3 for details.
5703  */
5704  inline long double
5705  theta_3l(long double __nu, long double __x)
5706  { return std::__detail::__theta_3<long double>(__nu, __x); }
5707 
5708  /**
5709  * Return the exponential theta-3 function @f$ \theta_3(\nu,x) @f$
5710  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5711  *
5712  * The exponential theta-3 function is defined by
5713  * @f[
5714  * \theta_3(\nu,x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi x}} \sum_{j=-\infty}^{+\infty}
5715  * \exp\left( \frac{-(\nu+j)^2}{x} \right)
5716  * @f]
5717  *
5718  * @param __nu The periodic (period = 1) argument
5719  * @param __x The argument
5720  */
5721  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
5722  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>
5723  theta_3(_Tpnu __nu, _Tp __x)
5724  {
5725  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
5726  return std::__detail::__theta_3<__type>(__nu, __x);
5727  }
5728 
5729  // Exponential theta_4 functions.
5730 
5731  /**
5732  * Return the exponential theta-4 function @f$ \theta_4(\nu,x) @f$
5733  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5734  *
5735  * @see theta_4 for details.
5736  */
5737  inline float
5738  theta_4f(float __nu, float __x)
5739  { return std::__detail::__theta_4<float>(__nu, __x); }
5740 
5741  /**
5742  * Return the exponential theta-4 function @f$ \theta_4(\nu,x) @f$
5743  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5744  *
5745  * @see theta_4 for details.
5746  */
5747  inline long double
5748  theta_4l(long double __nu, long double __x)
5749  { return std::__detail::__theta_4<long double>(__nu, __x); }
5750 
5751  /**
5752  * Return the exponential theta-4 function @f$ \theta_4(\nu,x) @f$
5753  * of period @f$ \nu @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5754  *
5755  * The exponential theta-4 function is defined by
5756  * @f[
5757  * \theta_4(\nu,x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi x}} \sum_{j=-\infty}^{+\infty}
5758  * \exp\left( \frac{-(\nu + j + 1/2)^2}{x} \right)
5759  * @f]
5760  *
5761  * @param __nu The periodic (period = 1) argument
5762  * @param __x The argument
5763  */
5764  template<typename _Tpnu, typename _Tp>
5765  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>
5766  theta_4(_Tpnu __nu, _Tp __x)
5767  {
5768  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpnu, _Tp>;
5769  return std::__detail::__theta_4<__type>(__nu, __x);
5770  }
5771 
5772  // Elliptic nome function
5773 
5774  /**
5775  * Return the elliptic nome function @f$ q(k) @f$
5776  * of modulus @f$ k @f$.
5777  *
5778  * @see ellnome for details.
5779  */
5780  inline float
5781  ellnomef(float __k)
5782  { return std::__detail::__ellnome<float>(__k); }
5783 
5784  /**
5785  * Return the elliptic nome function @f$ q(k) @f$
5786  * of <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$.
5787  *
5788  * @see ellnome for details.
5789  */
5790  inline long double
5791  ellnomel(long double __k)
5792  { return std::__detail::__ellnome<long double>(__k); }
5793 
5794  /**
5795  * Return the elliptic nome function @f$ q(k) @f$ of modulus @f$ k @f$.
5796  *
5797  * The elliptic nome function is defined by
5798  * @f[
5799  * q(k) = \exp \left(-\pi\frac{K(\sqrt{1-k^2})}{K(k)} \right)
5800  * @f]
5801  * where @f$ K(k) @f$ is the complete elliptic function of the first kind.
5802  *
5803  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the modulus
5804  * @param __k The modulus @f$ -1 <= k <= +1 @f$
5805  */
5806  template<typename _Tp>
5807  inline _Tp
5808  ellnome(_Tp __k)
5809  {
5810  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
5811  return std::__detail::__ellnome<__type>(__k);
5812  }
5813 
5814  // Neville theta_s functions.
5815 
5816  /**
5817  * Return the Neville theta-s function @f$ \theta_s(k,x) @f$
5818  * of modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5819  *
5820  * @see theta_s for details.
5821  */
5822  inline float
5823  theta_sf(float __k, float __x)
5824  { return std::__detail::__theta_s<float>(__k, __x); }
5825 
5826  /**
5827  * Return the Neville theta-s function @f$ \theta_s(k,x) @f$
5828  * of <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5829  *
5830  * @see theta_s for details.
5831  */
5832  inline long double
5833  theta_sl(long double __k, long double __x)
5834  { return std::__detail::__theta_s<long double>(__k, __x); }
5835 
5836  /**
5837  * Return the Neville theta-s function @f$ \theta_s(k,x) @f$
5838  * of modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5839  *
5840  * The Neville theta-s function is defined by
5841  * @f[
5842  * \theta_s(k,x) = \sqrt{\frac{\pi}{2 k k' K(k)}}
5843  * \theta_1\left(q(k),\frac{\pi x}{2K(k)}\right)
5844  * @f]
5845  * where @f$ q(k) @f$ is the elliptic nome, @f$ K(k) @f$ is
5846  * the complete Legendre elliptic integral of the first kind,
5847  * and @f$ \theta_1(\nu,x) @f$ is the exponential theta-1 function.
5848  * @see ellnome, std::comp_ellint_1, and theta_1 for details.
5849  *
5850  * @param __k The modulus @f$ -1 <= k <= +1 @f$
5851  * @param __x The argument
5852  */
5853  template<typename _Tpk, typename _Tp>
5854  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpk, _Tp>
5855  theta_s(_Tpk __k, _Tp __x)
5856  {
5857  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpk, _Tp>;
5858  return std::__detail::__theta_s<__type>(__k, __x);
5859  }
5860 
5861  // Neville theta_c functions.
5862 
5863  /**
5864  * Return the Neville theta-c function @f$ \theta_c(k,x) @f$
5865  * of modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5866  *
5867  * @see theta_c for details.
5868  */
5869  inline float
5870  theta_cf(float __k, float __x)
5871  { return std::__detail::__theta_c<float>(__k, __x); }
5872 
5873  /**
5874  * Return the Neville theta-c function @f$ \theta_c(k,x) @f$
5875  * of <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5876  *
5877  * @see theta_c for details.
5878  */
5879  inline long double
5880  theta_cl(long double __k, long double __x)
5881  { return std::__detail::__theta_c<long double>(__k, __x); }
5882 
5883  /**
5884  * Return the Neville theta-c function @f$ \theta_c(k,x) @f$
5885  * of modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5886  *
5887  * The Neville theta-c function is defined by
5888  * @f[
5889  * \theta_c(k,x) = \sqrt{\frac{\pi}{2 k K(k)}}
5890  * \theta_1\left(q(k),\frac{\pi x}{2K(k)}\right)
5891  * @f]
5892  * where @f$ q(k) @f$ is the elliptic nome, @f$ K(k) @f$ is
5893  * the complete Legendre elliptic integral of the first kind,
5894  * and @f$ \theta_1(\nu,x) @f$ is the exponential theta-1 function.
5895  * @see ellnome, std::comp_ellint_1, and theta_1 for details.
5896  *
5897  * @param __k The modulus @f$ -1 <= k <= +1 @f$
5898  * @param __x The argument
5899  */
5900  template<typename _Tpk, typename _Tp>
5901  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpk, _Tp>
5902  theta_c(_Tpk __k, _Tp __x)
5903  {
5904  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpk, _Tp>;
5905  return std::__detail::__theta_c<__type>(__k, __x);
5906  }
5907 
5908  // Neville theta_d functions.
5909 
5910  /**
5911  * Return the Neville theta-d function @f$ \theta_d(k,x) @f$
5912  * of modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5913  *
5914  * @see theta_d for details.
5915  */
5916  inline float
5917  theta_df(float __k, float __x)
5918  { return std::__detail::__theta_d<float>(__k, __x); }
5919 
5920  /**
5921  * Return the Neville theta-d function @f$ \theta_d(k,x) @f$
5922  * of <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5923  *
5924  * @see theta_d for details.
5925  */
5926  inline long double
5927  theta_dl(long double __k, long double __x)
5928  { return std::__detail::__theta_d<long double>(__k, __x); }
5929 
5930  /**
5931  * Return the Neville theta-d function @f$ \theta_d(k,x) @f$
5932  * of modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5933  *
5934  * The Neville theta-d function is defined by
5935  * @f[
5936  * \theta_d(k,x) = \sqrt{\frac{\pi}{2K(k)}}
5937  * \theta_3\left(q(k),\frac{\pi x}{2K(k)}\right)
5938  * @f]
5939  * where @f$ q(k) @f$ is the elliptic nome, @f$ K(k) @f$ is
5940  * the complete Legendre elliptic integral of the first kind,
5941  * and @f$ \theta_3(\nu,x) @f$ is the exponential theta-3 function.
5942  * @see ellnome, std::comp_ellint_1, and theta_3 for details.
5943  *
5944  * @param __k The modulus @f$ -1 <= k <= +1 @f$
5945  * @param __x The argument
5946  */
5947  template<typename _Tpk, typename _Tp>
5948  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpk, _Tp>
5949  theta_d(_Tpk __k, _Tp __x)
5950  {
5951  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpk, _Tp>;
5952  return std::__detail::__theta_d<__type>(__k, __x);
5953  }
5954 
5955  // Neville theta_n functions.
5956 
5957  /**
5958  * Return the Neville theta-n function @f$ \theta_n(k,x) @f$
5959  * of modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5960  *
5961  * @see theta_n for details.
5962  */
5963  inline float
5964  theta_nf(float __k, float __x)
5965  { return std::__detail::__theta_n<float>(__k, __x); }
5966 
5967  /**
5968  * Return the Neville theta-n function @f$ \theta_n(k,x) @f$
5969  * of <tt>long double</tt> modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5970  *
5971  * @see theta_n for details.
5972  */
5973  inline long double
5974  theta_nl(long double __k, long double __x)
5975  { return std::__detail::__theta_n<long double>(__k, __x); }
5976 
5977  /**
5978  * Return the Neville theta-n function @f$ \theta_n(k,x) @f$
5979  * of modulus @f$ k @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
5980  *
5981  * The Neville theta-n function is defined by
5982  * @f[
5983  * \theta_n(k,x) = \sqrt{\frac{\pi}{2k'K(k)}}
5984  * \theta_4\left(q(k),\frac{\pi x}{2K(k)}\right)
5985  * @f]
5986  * where @f$ q(k) @f$ is the elliptic nome, @f$ K(k) @f$ is
5987  * the complete Legendre elliptic integral of the first kind,
5988  * and @f$ \theta_4(\nu,x) @f$ is the exponential theta-4 function.
5989  * @see ellnome, std::comp_ellint_1, and theta_4 for details.
5990  *
5991  * @param __k The modulus @f$ -1 <= k <= +1 @f$
5992  * @param __x The argument
5993  */
5994  template<typename _Tpk, typename _Tp>
5995  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpk, _Tp>
5996  theta_n(_Tpk __k, _Tp __x)
5997  {
5998  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpk, _Tp>;
5999  return std::__detail::__theta_n<__type>(__k, __x);
6000  }
6001 
6002  // Jacobi theta_1 functions.
6003 
6004  /**
6005  * Return the Jacobi theta-1 function @f$ \theta_1(q,x) @f$
6006  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6007  *
6008  * @see jacobi_theta_1 for details.
6009  */
6010  inline float
6011  jacobi_theta_1f(float __q, float __x)
6012  { return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_1<float>(__q, __x); }
6013 
6014  /**
6015  * Return the Jacobi theta-1 function @f$ \theta_1(q,x) @f$
6016  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6017  *
6018  * @see jacobi_theta_1 for details.
6019  */
6020  inline long double
6021  jacobi_theta_1l(long double __q, long double __x)
6022  { return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_1<long double>(__q, __x); }
6023 
6024  /**
6025  * Return the Jacobi theta-1 function @f$ \theta_1(q,x) @f$
6026  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6027  *
6028  * The Jacobi theta-1 function is defined by
6029  * @f[
6030  * \theta_1(q,x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi x}} \sum_{j=-\infty}^{+\infty}
6031  * (-1)^j \exp\left( \frac{-(q + j - 1/2)^2}{x} \right)
6032  * @f]
6033  *
6034  * @param __q The periodic (period = 2) argument
6035  * @param __x The argument
6036  */
6037  template<typename _Tpq, typename _Tp>
6038  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpq, _Tp>
6039  jacobi_theta_1(_Tpq __q, _Tp __x)
6040  {
6041  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpq, _Tp>;
6042  return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_1<__type>(__q, __x);
6043  }
6044 
6045  // Jacobi theta_2 functions.
6046 
6047  /**
6048  * Return the Jacobi theta-2 function @f$ \theta_2(q,x) @f$
6049  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6050  *
6051  * @see jacobi_theta_2 for details.
6052  */
6053  inline float
6054  jacobi_theta_2f(float __q, float __x)
6055  { return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_2<float>(__q, __x); }
6056 
6057  /**
6058  * Return the Jacobi theta-2 function @f$ \theta_2(q,x) @f$
6059  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6060  *
6061  * @see jacobi_theta_2 for details.
6062  */
6063  inline long double
6064  jacobi_theta_2l(long double __q, long double __x)
6065  { return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_2<long double>(__q, __x); }
6066 
6067  /**
6068  * Return the Jacobi theta-2 function @f$ \theta_2(q,x) @f$
6069  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6070  *
6071  * The Jacobi theta-2 function is defined by
6072  * @f[
6073  * \theta_2(q,x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi x}} \sum_{j=-\infty}^{+\infty}
6074  * (-1)^j \exp\left( \frac{-(q + j)^2}{x} \right)
6075  * @f]
6076  *
6077  * @param __q The periodic (period = 2) argument
6078  * @param __x The argument
6079  */
6080  template<typename _Tpq, typename _Tp>
6081  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpq, _Tp>
6082  jacobi_theta_2(_Tpq __q, _Tp __x)
6083  {
6084  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpq, _Tp>;
6085  return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_2<__type>(__q, __x);
6086  }
6087 
6088  // Jacobi theta_3 functions.
6089 
6090  /**
6091  * Return the Jacobi theta-3 function @f$ \theta_3(q,x) @f$
6092  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6093  *
6094  * @see jacobi_theta_3 for details.
6095  */
6096  inline float
6097  jacobi_theta_3f(float __q, float __x)
6098  { return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_3<float>(__q, __x); }
6099 
6100  /**
6101  * Return the Jacobi theta-3 function @f$ \theta_3(q,x) @f$
6102  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6103  *
6104  * @see jacobi_theta_3 for details.
6105  */
6106  inline long double
6107  jacobi_theta_3l(long double __q, long double __x)
6108  { return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_3<long double>(__q, __x); }
6109 
6110  /**
6111  * Return the Jacobi theta-3 function @f$ \theta_3(q,x) @f$
6112  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6113  *
6114  * The Jacobi theta-3 function is defined by
6115  * @f[
6116  * \theta_3(q,x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi x}} \sum_{j=-\infty}^{+\infty}
6117  * \exp\left( \frac{-(q+j)^2}{x} \right)
6118  * @f]
6119  *
6120  * @param __q The elliptic nome
6121  * @param __x The argument
6122  */
6123  template<typename _Tpq, typename _Tp>
6124  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpq, _Tp>
6125  jacobi_theta_3(_Tpq __q, _Tp __x)
6126  {
6127  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpq, _Tp>;
6128  return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_3<__type>(__q, __x);
6129  }
6130 
6131  // Jacobi theta_4 functions.
6132 
6133  /**
6134  * Return the Jacobi theta-4 function @f$ \theta_4(q,x) @f$
6135  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6136  *
6137  * @see jacobi_theta_4 for details.
6138  */
6139  inline float
6140  jacobi_theta_4f(float __q, float __x)
6141  { return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_4<float>(__q, __x); }
6142 
6143  /**
6144  * Return the Jacobi theta-4 function @f$ \theta_4(q,x) @f$
6145  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6146  *
6147  * @see jacobi_theta_4 for details.
6148  */
6149  inline long double
6150  jacobi_theta_4l(long double __q, long double __x)
6151  { return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_4<long double>(__q, __x); }
6152 
6153  /**
6154  * Return the Jacobi theta-4 function @f$ \theta_4(q,x) @f$
6155  * of nome @f$ q @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$.
6156  *
6157  * The Jacobi theta-4 function is defined by
6158  * @f[
6159  * \theta_4(q,x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi x}} \sum_{j=-\infty}^{+\infty}
6160  * \exp\left( \frac{-(q + j + 1/2)^2}{x} \right)
6161  * @f]
6162  *
6163  * @param __q The elliptic nome
6164  * @param __x The argument
6165  */
6166  template<typename _Tpq, typename _Tp>
6167  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpq, _Tp>
6168  jacobi_theta_4(_Tpq __q, _Tp __x)
6169  {
6170  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tpq, _Tp>;
6171  return std::__detail::__jacobi_theta_4<__type>(__q, __x);
6172  }
6173 
6174  // Owens T functions.
6175 
6176  /**
6177  * Return the Owens T function @f$ T(h,a) @f$
6178  * of shape factor @f$ h @f$ and integration limit @f$ a @f$.
6179  *
6180  * @see owens_t for details.
6181  */
6182  inline float
6183  owens_tf(float __h, float __a)
6184  { return std::__detail::__owens_t<float>(__h, __a); }
6185 
6186  /**
6187  * Return the Owens T function @f$ T(h,a) @f$ of <tt>long double</tt>
6188  * shape factor @f$ h @f$ and integration limit @f$ a @f$.
6189  *
6190  * @see owens_t for details.
6191  */
6192  inline long double
6193  owens_tl(long double __h, long double __a)
6194  { return std::__detail::__owens_t<long double>(__h, __a); }
6195 
6196  /**
6197  * Return the Owens T function @f$ T(h,a) @f$ of shape factor @f$ h @f$
6198  * and integration limit @f$ a @f$.
6199  *
6200  * The Owens T function is defined by
6201  * @f[
6202  * T(h,a) = \frac{1}{2\pi}\int_0^a
6203  * \frac{\exp\left[-\frac{1}{2}h^2(1+x^2)\right]}{1+x^2} dx
6204  * @f]
6205  *
6206  * @param __h The shape factor
6207  * @param __a The integration limit
6208  */
6209  template<typename _Tph, typename _Tpa>
6210  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tph, _Tpa>
6211  owens_t(_Tph __h, _Tpa __a)
6212  {
6213  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tph, _Tpa>;
6214  return std::__detail::__owens_t<__type>(__h, __a);
6215  }
6216 
6217  // Fermi-Dirac integrals.
6218 
6219  /**
6220  * Return the Fermi-Dirac integral of @c float order s and argument x.
6221  *
6222  * @see fermi_dirac for details.
6223  */
6224  inline float
6225  fermi_diracf(float __s, float __x)
6226  { return std::__detail::__fermi_dirac<float>(__s, __x); }
6227 
6228  /**
6229  * Return the Fermi-Dirac integral of <tt> long double </tt>
6230  * order s and argument x.
6231  *
6232  * @see fermi_dirac for details.
6233  */
6234  inline long double
6235  fermi_diracl(long double __s, long double __x)
6236  { return std::__detail::__fermi_dirac<long double>(__s, __x); }
6237 
6238  /**
6239  * Return the Fermi-Dirac integral of integer or real order s
6240  * and real argument x.
6241  * @see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clausen_function
6242  * @see http://dlmf.nist.gov/25.12.16
6243  *
6244  * @f[
6245  * F_s(x) = \frac{1}{\Gamma(s+1)}\int_0^\infty \frac{t^s}{e^{t-x} + 1}dt
6246  * = -Li_{s+1}(-e^x)
6247  * @f]
6248  *
6249  * @param __s The order s > -1.
6250  * @param __x The real argument.
6251  * @return The real Fermi-Dirac integral F_s(x),
6252  */
6253  template<typename _Tps, typename _Tp>
6254  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tps, _Tp>
6255  fermi_dirac(_Tps __s, _Tp __x)
6256  {
6257  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tps, _Tp>;
6258  return std::__detail::__fermi_dirac<__type>(__s, __x);
6259  }
6260 
6261  // Bose-Einstein integrals.
6262 
6263  /**
6264  * Return the Bose-Einstein integral of @c float order s and argument x.
6265  *
6266  * @see bose_einstein for details.
6267  */
6268  inline float
6269  bose_einsteinf(float __s, float __x)
6270  { return std::__detail::__bose_einstein<float>(__s, __x); }
6271 
6272  /**
6273  * Return the Bose-Einstein integral of <tt> long double </tt>
6274  * order s and argument x.
6275  *
6276  * @see bose_einstein for details.
6277  */
6278  inline long double
6279  bose_einsteinl(long double __s, long double __x)
6280  { return std::__detail::__bose_einstein<long double>(__s, __x); }
6281 
6282  /**
6283  * Return the Bose-Einstein integral of integer or real order s
6284  * and real argument x.
6285  * @see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clausen_function
6286  * @see http://dlmf.nist.gov/25.12.16
6287  *
6288  * @f[
6289  * G_s(x) = \frac{1}{\Gamma(s+1)}\int_0^\infty \frac{t^s}{e^{t-x} - 1}dt
6290  * = Li_{s+1}(e^x)
6291  * @f]
6292  *
6293  * @param __s The order s >= 0.
6294  * @param __x The real argument.
6295  * @return The real Bose-Einstein integral G_s(x),
6296  */
6297  template<typename _Tps, typename _Tp>
6298  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tps, _Tp>
6299  bose_einstein(_Tps __s, _Tp __x)
6300  {
6301  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tps, _Tp>;
6302  return std::__detail::__bose_einstein<__type>(__s, __x);
6303  }
6304 
6305  // Reperiodized sine function.
6306 
6307  /**
6308  * Return the reperiodized sine function @f$ \sin_\pi(x) @f$
6309  * for @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
6310  *
6311  * @see sin_pi for more details.
6312  */
6313  inline float
6314  sin_pif(float __x)
6315  { return std::__detail::__sin_pi<float>(__x); }
6316 
6317  /**
6318  * Return the reperiodized sine function @f$ \sin_\pi(x) @f$
6319  * for <tt>long double</tt> argument @f$ x @f$.
6320  *
6321  * @see sin_pi for more details.
6322  */
6323  inline long double
6324  sin_pil(long double __x)
6325  { return std::__detail::__sin_pi<long double>(__x); }
6326 
6327  /**
6328  * Return the reperiodized sine function @f$ \sin_\pi(x) @f$
6329  * for real argument @f$ x @f$.
6330  *
6331  * The reperiodized sine function is defined by:
6332  * @f[
6333  * \sin_\pi(x) = \sin(\pi x)
6334  * @f]
6335  *
6336  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
6337  * @param __x The argument
6338  */
6339  template<typename _Tp>
6340  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
6341  sin_pi(_Tp __x)
6342  {
6343  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6344  return std::__detail::__sin_pi<__type>(__x);
6345  }
6346 
6347  // Reperiodized hyperbolic sine function.
6348

6350  * Return the reperiodized hyperbolic sine function @f$ \sinh_\pi(x) @f$

6352  *
6353  * @see sinh_pi for more details.
6354  */
6355  inline float
6356  sinh_pif(float __x)
6357  { return std::__detail::__sinh_pi<float>(__x); }

6360  * Return the reperiodized hyperbolic sine function @f$ \sinh_\pi(x) @f$

6363  * @see sinh_pi for more details.
6364  */
6365  inline long double
6366  sinh_pil(long double __x)
6367  { return std::__detail::__sinh_pi<long double>(__x); }
6368 
6369  /**
6370  * Return the reperiodized hyperbolic sine function @f$ \sinh_\pi(x) @f$
6371  * for real argument @f$ x @f$.
6372  *
6373  * The reperiodized hyperbolic sine function is defined by:
6374  * @f[
6375  * \sinh_\pi(x) = \sinh(\pi x)
6376  * @f]
6377  *
6378  * @tparam _Tp The floating-point type of the argument @c __x.
6379  * @param __x The argument
6380  */
6381  template<typename _Tp>
6382  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
6383  sinh_pi(_Tp __x)
6384  {
6385  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6386  return std::__detail::__sinh_pi<__type>(__x);
6387  }

6551  tanh_pi(_Tp __x)
