6557  /**
6558  * Return both the sine and the cosine of a @c float argument.
6559  */
6560  inline __gnu_cxx::__sincos_t<float>
6561  sincosf(float __x)
6562  { return std::__detail::__sincos<float>(__x); }
6563 
6564  /**
6565  * Return both the sine and the cosine of a <tt> long double </tt> argument.
6566  *
6567  * @see sincos for details.
6568  */
6569  inline __gnu_cxx::__sincos_t<long double>
6570  sincosl(long double __x)
6571  { return std::__detail::__sincos<long double>(__x); }
6572 
6573  /**
6574  * Return both the sine and the cosine of a @c double argument.
6575  *
6576  * @see sincos for details.
6577  */
6578  inline __gnu_cxx::__sincos_t<double>
6579  sincos(double __x)
6580  { return std::__detail::__sincos<double>(__x); }
6581 
6582  /**
6583  * Return both the sine and the cosine of a reperiodized argument.
6584  * @f[
6585  * sincos(x) = {\sin(x), \cos(x)}
6586  * @f]
6587  */
6588  template<typename _Tp>
6589  inline __gnu_cxx::__sincos_t<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>>
6590  sincos(_Tp __x)
6591  {
6592  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6593  return std::__detail::__sincos<__type>(__x);
6594  }
6595 
6596  /**
6597  * Return both the sine and the cosine of a reperiodized @c float argument.
6598  *
6599  * @see sincos_pi for details.
6600  */
6601  inline __gnu_cxx::__sincos_t<float>
6602  sincos_pif(float __x)
6603  { return std::__detail::__sincos_pi<float>(__x); }
6604 
6605  /**
6606  * Return both the sine and the cosine of a reperiodized
6607  * <tt> long double </tt> argument.
6608  *
6609  * @see sincos_pi for details.
6610  */
6611  inline __gnu_cxx::__sincos_t<long double>
6612  sincos_pil(long double __x)
6613  { return std::__detail::__sincos_pi<long double>(__x); }
6614 
6615  /**
6616  * Return both the sine and the cosine of a reperiodized real argument.
6617  *
6618  * @f[
6619  * sincos_\pi(x) = {\sin(\pi x), \cos(\pi x)}
6620  * @f]
6621  */
6622  template<typename _Tp>
6623  inline __gnu_cxx::__sincos_t<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>>
6624  sincos_pi(_Tp __x)
6625  {
6626  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6627  return std::__detail::__sincos_pi<__type>(__x);
6628  }
6629 
6630  /**
6631  * @brief Return the gamma propability distribution function.
6632  *
6633  * The formula for the gamma probability density function is:
6634  * @f[
6635  * \Gamma(x|\alpha,\beta) = \frac{1}{\beta\Gamma(\alpha)}
6636  * (x/\beta)^{\alpha - 1} e^{-x/\beta}
6637  * @f]
6638  */
6639  template<typename _Ta, typename _Tb, typename _Tp>
6640  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>
6641  gamma_pdf(_Ta __alpha, _Tb __beta, _Tp __x)
6642  {
6643  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>;
6644  return std::__detail::__gamma_pdf<__type>(__alpha, __beta, __x);
6645  }
6646 
6647  /**
6648  * @brief Return the gamma cumulative propability distribution function.
6649  *
6650  * The formula for the gamma probability density function is:
6651  * @f[
6652  * \Gamma(x|\alpha,\beta) = \frac{1}{\beta\Gamma(\alpha)}
6653  * (x/\beta)^{\alpha - 1} e^{-x/\beta}
6654  * @f]
6655  template<typename _Ta, typename _Tb, typename _Tp>
6656  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>
6657  gamma_p(_Ta __alpha, _Tb __beta, _Tp __x)
6658  {
6659  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>;
6660  return std::__detail::__gamma_p<__type>(__alpha, __beta, __x);
6661  }
6662  */
6663 
6664  /**
6665  * @brief Return the normal probability density function.
6666  *
6667  * The formula for the normal probability density function is
6668  * @f[
6669  * f(x|\mu,\sigma) = \frac{e^{(x-\mu)^2/2\sigma^2}}{\sigma\sqrt{2\pi}}
6670  * @f]
6671  */
6672  template<typename _Tmu, typename _Tsig, typename _Tp>
6673  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tmu, _Tsig, _Tp>
6674  normal_pdf(_Tmu __mu, _Tsig __sigma, _Tp __x)
6675  {
6676  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tmu, _Tsig, _Tp>;
6677  return std::__detail::__normal_pdf<__type>(__mu, __sigma, __x);
6678  }
6679 
6680  /**
6681  * @brief Return the normal cumulative probability density function.
6682  *
6683  * The formula for the normal cumulative probability density function is
6684  * @f[
6685  * F(x|\mu,\sigma)
6686  * = \frac{1}{2}\left[ 1-erf(\frac{x-\mu}{\sqrt{2}\sigma}) \right]
6687  * @f]
6688  */
6689  template<typename _Tmu, typename _Tsig, typename _Tp>
6690  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tmu, _Tsig, _Tp>
6691  normal_p(_Tmu __mu, _Tsig __sigma, _Tp __x)
6692  {
6693  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tmu, _Tsig, _Tp>;
6694  return std::__detail::__normal_p<__type>(__mu, __sigma, __x);
6695  }
6696 
6697  /**
6698  * @brief Return the lognormal probability density function.
6699  *
6700  * The formula for the lognormal probability density function is
6701  * @f[
6702  * f(x|\mu,\sigma) = \frac{e^{(\ln{x}-\mu)^2/2\sigma^2}}{\sigma\sqrt{2\pi}}
6703  * @f]
6704  */
6705  template<typename _Tmu, typename _Tsig, typename _Tp>
6706  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tmu, _Tsig, _Tp>
6707  lognormal_pdf(_Tmu __mu, _Tsig __sigma, _Tp __x)
6708  {
6709  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tmu, _Tsig, _Tp>;
6710  return std::__detail::__lognormal_pdf<__type>(__mu, __sigma, __x);
6711  }
6712 
6713  /**
6714  * @brief Return the lognormal cumulative probability density function.
6715  *
6716  * The formula for the lognormal cumulative probability density function is
6717  * @f[
6718  * F(x|\mu,\sigma)
6719  * = \frac{1}{2}\left[1-erf\left(
6720  * \frac{\ln{x}-\mu}{\sqrt{2}\sigma}\right)\right]
6721  * @f]
6722  */
6723  template<typename _Tmu, typename _Tsig, typename _Tp>
6724  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tmu, _Tsig, _Tp>
6725  lognormal_p(_Tmu __mu, _Tsig __sigma, _Tp __x)
6726  {
6727  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tmu, _Tsig, _Tp>;
6728  return std::__detail::__lognormal_p<__type>(__mu, __sigma, __x);
6729  }
6730 
6731  /**
6732  * @brief Return the exponential probability density function.
6733  *
6734  * The formula for the exponential probability density function is
6735  * @f[
6736  * f(x|\lambda) = \lambda e^{-\lambda x} \mbox{ for } x >= 0
6737  * @f]
6738  */
6739  template<typename _Tlam, typename _Tp>
6740  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tlam, _Tp>
6741  exponential_pdf(_Tlam __lambda, _Tp __x)
6742  {
6743  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tlam, _Tp>;
6744  return std::__detail::__exponential_pdf<__type>(__lambda, __x);
6745  }
6746 
6747  /**
6748  * @brief Return the exponential cumulative probability density function.
6749  *
6750  * The formula for the exponential cumulative probability density function is
6751  * @f[
6752  * F(x|\lambda) = 1 - e^{-\lambda x} \mbox{ for } x >= 0
6753  * @f]
6754  */
6755  template<typename _Tlam, typename _Tp>
6756  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tlam, _Tp>
6757  exponential_p(_Tlam __lambda, _Tp __x)
6758  {
6759  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tlam, _Tp>;
6760  return std::__detail::__exponential_p<__type>(__lambda, __x);
6761  }
6762 
6763  /**
6764  * @brief Return the Weibull probability density function.
6765  *
6766  * The formula for the Weibull probability density function is
6767  * @f[
6768  * f(x | a, b) = \frac{a}{b}
6769  * \left(\frac{x}{b} \right)^{a-1}
6770  * \exp{-\left(\frac{x}{b}\right)^a}
6771  * \mbox{ for } x >= 0
6772  * @f]
6773  */
6774  template<typename _Ta, typename _Tb, typename _Tp>
6775  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>
6776  weibull_pdf(_Ta __a, _Tb __b, _Tp __x)
6777  {
6778  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>;
6779  return std::__detail::__weibull_pdf<__type>(__a, __b, __x);
6780  }
6781 
6782  /**
6783  * @brief Return the Weibull cumulative probability density function.
6784  *
6785  * The formula for the Weibull cumulative probability density function is
6786  * @f[
6787  * F(x|\lambda) = 1 - e^{-(x / b)^a} \mbox{ for } x >= 0
6788  * @f]
6789  */
6790  template<typename _Ta, typename _Tb, typename _Tp>
6791  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>
6792  weibull_p(_Ta __a, _Tb __b, _Tp __x)
6793  {
6794  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>;
6795  return std::__detail::__weibull_p<__type>(__a, __b, __x);
6796  }
6797 
6798  /**
6799  * @brief Return the complement of the Students T probability function.
6800  *
6801  * The complement of the students T propability function is:
6802  * @f[
6803  * A_c(t|\nu) = I_{\frac{\nu}{\nu + t^2}}(\frac{\nu}{2}, \frac{1}{2})
6804  * = 1 - A(t|\nu)
6805  * @f]
6806  *
6807  * @param __t
6808  * @param __nu
6809  */
6810  template<typename _Tt, typename _Tp>
6811  __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
6812  student_t_pdf(_Tt __t, unsigned int __nu)
6813  {
6814  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6815  return std::__detail::__student_t_pdf<__type>(__t, __nu);
6816  }
6817 
6818  /**
6819  * @brief Return the Students T probability function.
6820  *
6821  * The students T propability function is related to the incomplete beta function:
6822  * @f[
6823  * A(t|\nu) = 1 - I_{\frac{\nu}{\nu + t^2}}(\frac{\nu}{2}, \frac{1}{2})
6824  * @f]
6825  * (see ibeta).
6826  *
6827  * @param __t
6828  * @param __nu
6829  */
6830  template<typename _Tt, typename _Tp>
6831  __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
6832  student_t_p(_Tt __t, unsigned int __nu)
6833  {
6834  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6835  return std::__detail::__student_t_p<__type>(__t, __nu);
6836  }
6837 
6838  /**
6839  * @brief Return the F-distribution propability function.
6840  * This returns the probability that the observed chi-square
6841  * for a correct model exceeds the value @f$ \chi^2 @f$.
6842  *
6843  * The f-distribution propability function is related
6844  * to the incomplete beta function:
6845  * @f[
6846  * P(F|\nu_1, \nu_2) = 1 - I_{\frac{\nu_2}{\nu_2 + \nu_1 F}}
6847  * (\frac{\nu_2}{2}, \frac{\nu_1}{2})
6848  * = 1 - Q(F|\nu_1, \nu_2)
6849  * @f]
6850  *
6851  * @param __F
6852  * @param __nu1
6853  * @param __nu2
6854  */
6855  template<typename _Tp>
6856  __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
6857  fisher_f_pdf(_Tp __F, unsigned int __nu1, unsigned int __nu2)
6858  {
6859  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6860  return std::__detail::__fisher_f_pdf<__type>(__F, __nu1, __nu2);
6861  }
6862 
6863  /**
6864  * @brief Return the F-distribution propability function.
6865  * This returns the probability that the observed chi-square for a correct model
6866  * exceeds the value @f$ \chi^2 @f$.
6867  *
6868  * The f-distribution propability function is related to the incomplete beta function:
6869  * @f[
6870  * Q(F|\nu_1, \nu_2) = I_{\frac{\nu_2}{\nu_2 + \nu_1 F}}
6871  * (\frac{\nu_2}{2}, \frac{\nu_1}{2})
6872  * @f]
6873  *
6874  * @param __nu1 The number of degrees of freedom of sample 1
6875  * @param __nu2 The number of degrees of freedom of sample 2
6876  * @param __F The F statistic
6877  */
6878  template<typename _Tp>
6879  __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
6880  fisher_f_p(_Tp __F, unsigned int __nu1, unsigned int __nu2)
6881  {
6882  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6883  return std::__detail::__fisher_f_p<__type>(__F, __nu1, __nu2);
6884  }
6885 
6886  /**
6887  * @brief Return the binomial probability mass function.
6888  *
6889  * The binomial cumulative distribution function is related
6890  * to the incomplete beta function:
6891  * @f[
6892  * f(k|n,p) = \binom{n}{k}p^k(1-p)^{n-k}
6893  * @f]
6894  *
6895  * @param __p
6896  * @param __n
6897  * @param __k
6898  */
6899  template<typename _Tp>
6900  __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
6901  binomial_pdf(_Tp __p, unsigned int __n, unsigned int __k)
6902  {
6903  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6904  return std::__detail::__binomial_pdf<__type>(__p, __n, __k);
6905  }
6906 
6907  /**
6908  * @brief Return the binomial cumulative distribution function.
6909  *
6910  * The binomial cumulative distribution function is related
6911  * to the incomplete beta function:
6912  * @f[
6913  * P(k|n,p) = I_p(k, n-k+1)
6914  * @f]
6915  *
6916  * @param __p
6917  * @param __n
6918  * @param __k
6919  */
6920  template<typename _Tp>
6921  __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
6922  binomial_p(_Tp __p, unsigned int __n, unsigned int __k)
6923  {
6924  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
6925  return std::__detail::__binomial_p<__type>(__p, __n, __k);
6926  }
6927 
6928  /**
6929  * @brief Return the logistic probability density function.
6930  *
6931  * The formula for the logistic probability density function is
6932  * @f[
6933  * f(x| a, b) = \frac{e^{(x - a)/b}}{b[1 + e^{(x - a)/b}]^2}
6934  * @f]
6935  * where @f$b > 0@f$.
6936  */
6937  template<typename _Ta, typename _Tb, typename _Tp>
6938  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>
6939  logistic_pdf(_Ta __a, _Tb __b, _Tp __x)
6940  {
6941  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>;
6942  return std::__detail::__logistic_pdf<__type>(__a, __b, __x);
6943  }
6944 
6945  /**
6946  * @brief Return the logistic cumulative distribution function.
6947  *
6948  * The formula for the logistic probability function is
6949  * @f[
6950  * P(x| a, b) = \frac{e^{(x - a)/b}}{1 + e^{(x - a)/b}}
6951  * @f]
6952  * where @f$b > 0@f$.
6953  */
6954  template<typename _Ta, typename _Tb, typename _Tp>
6955  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>
6956  logistic_p(_Ta __a, _Tb __b, _Tp __x)
6957  {
6958  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta, _Tb, _Tp>;
6959  return std::__detail::__logistic_p<__type>(__a, __b, __x);
6960  }
6961 
6962  // Reciprocal Gamma function.
6963 
6964  /**
6965  * Return the reciprocal gamma function for <tt> float </tt> argument.
6966  *
6967  * @see gamma_reciprocal for details.
6968  */
6969  inline float
6970  gamma_reciprocalf(float __a)
6971  { return std::__detail::__gamma_reciprocal<float>(__a); }
6972 
6973  /**
6974  * Return the reciprocal gamma function for <tt> long double </tt>
6975  * argument.
6976  *
6977  * @see gamma_reciprocal for details.
6978  */
6979  inline long double
6980  gamma_reciprocall(long double __a)
6981  { return std::__detail::__gamma_reciprocal<long double>(__a); }
6982 
6983  /**
6984  * Return the reciprocal gamma function for real argument.
6985  *
6986  * The reciprocal of the Gamma function is what you'd expect:
6987  * @f[
6988  * \Gamma_r(a) = \frac{1}{\Gamma(a)}
6989  * @f]
6990  * But unlike the Gamma function this function has no singularities
6991  * and is exponentially decreasing for increasing argument.
6992  */
6993  template<typename _Ta>
6994  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta>
6995  gamma_reciprocal(_Ta __a)
6996  {
6997  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Ta>;
6998  return std::__detail::__gamma_reciprocal<__type>(__a);
6999  }
7000 
7001  // Debye functions.
7002 
7003  /**
7004  * Return the Debye function @f$ D_n(x) @f$
7005  * of positive order @f$ n @f$ and @c float argument @f$ x @f$.
7006  *
7007  * @see debye for details.
7008  */
7009  inline float
7010  debyef(unsigned int __n, float __x)
7011  { return std::__detail::__debye<float>(__n, __x); }
7012 
7013  /**
7014  * Return the Debye function @f$ D_n(x) @f$
7015  * of positive order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
7016  *
7017  * @see debye for details.
7018  */
7019  inline long double
7020  debyel(unsigned int __n, long double __x)
7021  { return std::__detail::__debye<long double>(__n, __x); }
7022 
7023  /**
7024  * Return the Debye function @f$ D_n(x) @f$
7025  * of positive order @f$ n @f$ and real argument @f$ x @f$.
7026  *
7027  * The Debye function is defined by:
7028  * @f[
7029  * D_n(x) = \frac{n}{x^n}\int_{0}^{x}\frac{t^n}{e^t-1}dt
7030  * @f]
7031  *
7032  * @tparam _Tp The real type of the argument
7033  * @param __n The positive integral order
7034  * @param __x The real argument @f$ x >= 0 @f$
7035  */
7036  template<typename _Tp>
7037  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>
7038  debye(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
7039  {
7040  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp>;
7041  return std::__detail::__debye<__type>(__n, __x);
7042  }
7043 
7044  /**
7045  * Return the Bernoulli polynomial @f$ B_n(x) @f$ of order n at argument x.
7046  *
7047  * The values at 0 and 1 are equal to the corresponding Bernoulli number:
7048  * @f[
7049  * B_n(0) = B_n(1) = B_n
7050  * @f]
7051  *
7052  * The derivative is proportional to the previous polynomial:
7053  * @f[
7054  * B_n'(x) = n B_{n-1}(x)
7055  * @f]
7056  *
7057  * The series expansion for the Bernoulli polynomials is:
7058  * @f[
7059  * B_n(x) = \sum_{k=0}^{n} B_k \binom{n}{k} x^{n-k}
7060  * @f]
7061  *
7062  * A useful argument promotion is:
7063  * @f[
7064  * B_n(x+1) - B_n(x) = n x^{n-1}
7065  * @f]
7066  */
7067  template<typename _Tp>
7068  inline _Tp
7069  bernoulli(unsigned int __n, _Tp __x)
7070  { return std::__detail::__bernoulli(__n, __x); }
7071 
7072  /**
7073  * @brief This returns Euler number @f$ E_n @f$.
7074  *
7075  * @param __n the order n of the Euler number.
7076  * @return The Euler number of order n.
7077  */
7078  template<typename _Tp>
7079  inline _Tp
7080  euler(unsigned int __n)
7081  { return std::__detail::__euler<_Tp>(__n); }
7082 
7083  /**
7084  * Return the Eulerian number of the first kind.
7085  * The Eulerian numbers of the first kind are defined by recursion:
7086  * @f[
7087  * \genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n}{m}
7088  * = (n-m)\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n-1}{m-1}
7089  * + (m+1)\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n-1}{m}
7090  * \mbox{ for } n > 0
7091  * @f]
7092  * Note that @f$ A(n,m) @f$ is a common older notation.
7093  */
7094  template<typename _Tp>
7095  inline _Tp
7096  eulerian_1(unsigned int __n, unsigned int __m)
7097  { return std::__detail::__eulerian_1<_Tp>(__n, __m); }
7098 
7099  /**
7100  * Return a vector of Eulerian numbers of the first kind.
7101  */
7102  template<typename _Tp>
7103  inline std::vector<_Tp>
7104  eulerian_1(unsigned int __n)
7105  { return std::__detail::__eulerian_1<_Tp>(__n); }
7106 
7107  /**
7108  * Return the Eulerian number of the second kind.
7109  * The Eulerian numbers of the second kind are defined by recursion:
7110  * @f[
7111  * \left\langle\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n}{m}\right\rangle
7112  * = (2n-m-1)
7113  * \left\langle\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n-1}{m-1}\right\rangle
7114  * + (m+1)
7115  * \left\langle\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n-1}{m}\right\rangle
7116  * \mbox{ for } n > 0
7117  * @f]
7118  */
7119  template<typename _Tp>
7120  inline _Tp
7121  eulerian_2(unsigned int __n, unsigned int __m)
7122  { return std::__detail::__eulerian_2<_Tp>(__n, __m); }
7123 
7124  /**
7125  * Return the Stirling number of the first kind.
7126  *
7127  * The Stirling numbers of the first kind are the coefficients of
7128  * the Pocchammer polynomials or the rising factorials:
7129  * @f[
7130  * (x)_n = \sum_{k=0}^{n} \genfrac{[}{]}{0pt}{0}{n}{k} x^k
7131  * @f]
7132  *
7133  * The recursion is
7134  * @f[
7135  * \genfrac{[}{]}{0pt}{0}{n+1}{m} = \genfrac{[}{]}{0pt}{0}{n}{m-1}
7136  * - n \genfrac{[}{]}{0pt}{0}{n}{m}
7137  * @f]
7138  * with starting values
7139  * @f[
7140  * \genfrac{[}{]}{0pt}{0}{0}{0\rightarrow m} = {1, 0, 0, ..., 0}
7141  * @f]
7142  * and
7143  * @f[
7144  * \genfrac{[}{]}{0pt}{0}{0\rightarrow n}{0} = {1, 0, 0, ..., 0}
7145  * @f]
7146  * The Stirling number of the first kind is denoted by other symbols
7147  * in the literature, usually @f$ S_n^{(m)} @f$.
7148  */
7149  template<typename _Tp>
7150  inline _Tp
7151  stirling_1(unsigned int __n, unsigned int __m)
7152  { return std::__detail::__stirling_1<_Tp>(__n, __m); }
7153 
7154  /**
7155  * Return a vector of Stirling numbers of the first kind.
7156  */
7157  template<typename _Tp>
7158  inline std::vector<_Tp>
7159  stirling_1(unsigned int __n)
7160  { return std::__detail::__stirling_1<_Tp>(__n); }
7161 
7162  /**
7163  * Return the Stirling number of the second kind by series expansion
7164  * or by recursion.
7165  *
7166  * The series is:
7167  * @f[
7168  * \sigma_n^{(m)} = \genfrac{\{}{\}}{0pt}{0}{n}{m}
7169  * = \sum_{k=0}^{m}\frac{(-1)^{m-k}k^n}{(m-k)!k!}
7170  * @f]
7171  *
7172  * The Stirling number of the second kind is denoted by other symbols
7173  * in the literature:
7174  * @f$ \sigma_n^{(m)} @f$, @f$ \textit{S}_n^{(m)} @f$ and others.
7175  */
7176  template<typename _Tp>
7177  inline _Tp
7178  stirling_2(unsigned int __n, unsigned int __m)
7179  { return std::__detail::__stirling_2<_Tp>(__n, __m); }
7180 
7181  /**
7182  * Return a vector of Stirling numbers of the second kind.
7183  */
7184  template<typename _Tp>
7185  inline std::vector<_Tp>
7186  stirling_2(unsigned int __n)
7187  { return std::__detail::__stirling_2<_Tp>(__n); }
7188 
7189  /**
7190  * Return the Lah number.
7191  * Lah numbers are defined by downward recurrence:
7192  * @f[
7193  * L(n,k-1) = \frac{k(k-1)}{n-k+1}L(n,k); L(n,n) = 1
7194  * @f]
7195  */
7196  template<typename _Tp>
7197  inline _Tp
7198  lah(unsigned int __n, unsigned int __k)
7199  { return std::__detail::__lah<_Tp>(__n, __k); }
7200 
7201  /**
7202  * Return a vector of Lah numbers.
7203  * Lah numbers are defined by downward recurrence:
7204  * @f[
7205  * L(n,k-1) = \frac{k(k-1)}{n-k+1}L(n,k); L(n,n) = 1
7206  * @f]
7207  */
7208  template<typename _Tp>
7209  inline std::vector<_Tp>
7210  lah(unsigned int __n)
7211  { return std::__detail::__lah<_Tp>(__n); }
7212 
7213  /**
7214  * Return a vector of the Bell numbers
7215  * @f[
7216  * B(n) = \sum_{k=0}^{n}S_n^{(k)}
7217  * @f]
7218  * where @f$ S_n^{(k)} @f$ are the Stirling numbers of the second kind.
7219  */
7220  template<typename _Tp>
7221  inline std::vector<_Tp>
7222  bell(unsigned int __n)
7223  { return std::__detail::__bell<_Tp>(__n); }
7224 
7225  /**
7226  * Evaluate the Bell polynomial
7227  * @f[
7228  * B(n,x) = \sum_{k=0}^{n}S_n^{(k)}x^k
7229  * @f]
7230  * where @f$ S_n^{(k)} @f$ are the Stirling numbers of the second kind.
7231  */
7232  template<typename _Tp, typename _Up>
7233  inline _Up
7234  bell(unsigned int __n, _Up __x)
7235  { return std::__detail::__bell(__n, __x); }
7236 
7237  /**
7238  * Return the Lerch transcendent @f$ \Phi(z,s,a) @f$ for @c float arguments.
7239  *
7240  * @see lerch_phi for details.
7241  */
7242  inline float
7243  lerch_phif(float __z, float __s, float __a)
7244  { return std::__detail::__lerch_phi<float>(__z, __s, __a); }
7245 
7246  /**
7247  * Return the Lerch transcendent @f$ \Phi(z,s,a) @f$
7248  * for <tt> long double </tt> arguments.
7249  *
7250  * @see lerch_phi for details.
7251  */
7252  inline long double
7253  lerch_phil(long double __z, long double __s, long double __a)
7254  { return std::__detail::__lerch_phi<long double>(__z, __s, __a); }
7255 
7256  /**
7257  * Return the Lerch transcendent @f$ \Phi(z,s,a) @f$.
7258  *
7259  * The series is:
7260  * @f[
7261  * \Phi(z,s,a) = \sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{z^k}{(k+a)^s}
7262  * @f]
7263  *
7264  * @param __z The argument.
7265  * @param __s The order @f$ s != 1 @f$.
7266  * @param __a The scale parameter @f$ a > -1 @f$.
7267  */
7268  template<typename _Tp, typename _Ts, typename _Ta>
7269  inline __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Ts, _Ta>
7270  lerch_phi(_Tp __z, _Ts __s, _Ta __a)
7271  {
7272  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Ts, _Ta>;
7273  return std::__detail::__lerch_phi<__type>(__z, __s, __a);
7274  }
7275 
7276  /**
7277  * Compute the Mittag-Leffer function:
7278  * @f[
7279  * E_{\alpha,\beta}(z) = \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{z^k}{\beta + \alpha k},
7280  * \mbox{ } \alpha > 0, \beta \in \$\mathbb{C}\$, z \in \$\mathbb{C}\$
7281  * @f]
7282  *
7283  * @see COMPUTATION OF THE MITTAG-LEFFLER FUNCTION @f$ E_{\alpha,\beta}(z) @f$
7284  * AND ITS DERIVATIVE, Rudolf Gorenflo, Joulia Loutchko & Yuri Luchko
7285  */
7286  template<typename _Tp, typename _Ta, typename _Tb>
7287  inline std::complex<__gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Ta, _Tb>>
7288  mittag_leffler(_Ta __alpha, _Tb __beta, const std::complex<_Tp>& __z)
7289  {
7290  using __type = __gnu_cxx::fp_promote_t<_Tp, _Ta, _Tb>;
7291  return std::__detail::__mittag_leffler<__type>(__alpha, __beta, __z);
7292  }
7293 
7294 #endif // __cplusplus >= 201103L
7295 
7296  /** @} */ // gnu_math_spec_func
7297 
7298 _GLIBCXX_END_NAMESPACE_VERSION
7299 } // namespace __gnu_cxx
7300 
7301 #if __cplusplus > 201402L
7302 
7303 namespace std _GLIBCXX_VISIBILITY(default)
7304 {
7305 _GLIBCXX_BEGIN_NAMESPACE_VERSION
7306 
7307  // [c.math.hypot3], three-dimensional hypotenuse
7308 #define __cpp_lib_hypot 201603
7309 
7310 #include <limits>
7311 
7312  // Avoid including all of <algorithm>
7313  template<typename _Tp>
7314  constexpr _Tp
7315  __fmax3(_Tp __x, _Tp __y, _Tp __z)
7316  { return std::fmax(std::fmax(__x, __y), std::fmax(__y, __z)); }
7317 
7318  template<typename _Tp>
7319  constexpr _Tp
7320  __hypot3(_Tp __x, _Tp __y, _Tp __z)
7321  {
7322  if (std::isnan(__x)
7323  || std::isnan(__y)
7324  || std::isnan(__z))
7325  return std::numeric_limits<_Tp>::quiet_NaN();
7326  else
7327  {
7328  __x = std::abs(__x);
7329  __y = std::abs(__y);
7330  __z = std::abs(__z);
7331  const auto __amax = __fmax3(__x, __y, __z);
7332  if (__amax == _Tp{0})
7333  return _Tp{0};
7334  else if (std::isinf(__amax))
7335  return std::numeric_limits<_Tp>::infinity();
7336  else
7337  {
7338  __x /= __amax;
7339  __y /= __amax;
7340  __z /= __amax;
7341  return __amax * std::sqrt(__x * __x + __y * __y + __z * __z);
7342  }
7343  }
7344  }
7345 
7346  /**
7347  * Return the three-dimensional hypoteneuse @f$ \sqrt{x^2 + y^2 + z^2} @f$
7348  * for @c float arguments x, y, and z.
7349  */
7350  constexpr inline float
7351  hypot(float __x, float __y, float __z)
7352  { return std::__hypot3<float>(__x, __y, __z); }
7353 
7354  /**
7355  * Return the three-dimensional hypoteneuse @f$ \sqrt{x^2 + y^2 + z^2} @f$
7356  * for <tt>long double</tt> arguments x, y, and z.
7357  */
7358  constexpr inline long double
7359  hypot(long double __x, long double __y, long double __z)
7360  { return std::__hypot3<long double>(__x, __y, __z); }
7361 
7362  /**
7363  * Return the three-dimensional hypoteneuse @f$ \sqrt{x^2 + y^2 + z^2} @f$
7364  * for real arguments x, y, and z.
7365  */
7366  template<typename _Tp, typename _Up, typename _Vp>
7367  constexpr typename __gnu_cxx::__promote_3<_Tp, _Up, _Vp>::__type
7368  hypot(_Tp __x, _Up __y, _Vp __z)
7369  {
7370  using __type = typename __gnu_cxx::__promote_3<_Tp, _Up, _Vp>::__type;
7371  return std::__hypot3<__type>(__x, __y, __z);
7372  }
7373 
7374 _GLIBCXX_END_NAMESPACE_VERSION
7375 } // namespace
7376 
7377 #endif // C++17
7378
